Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Rbtvanhorn
Reviews.Content: I usually stay here when I visit Chicago great rooms and a great view I usually stay in room 974 or 1274 great service and every room has a flat screen in it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Budget Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Clint P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on St. Patty's day weekend and was happy with my choice. The lobby and bar area are very nice and updated. The rooms were dated but still comfortable. The location and price are the best parts about the hotel. I really didn't spend that much time there as we were out and about visiting the nearby parks, bars, restaurants, parade, green river, etc (all within walking distance) on Michigan Ave and Loop area. The service was very friendly and professional. People talk about the striking workers but they were out of the way and didn't bother anyone. I would stay here again based on the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews make it sound.”
Reviews.Author: pastparticiple
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you choose to stay here it is probably because you don't want to pay the crazy prices of the 'upscale' downtown options. Don't expect the same experience if you are not willing to pay for it! Is the Congress old? Yes! Is its quality less than the Hilton down the street? Yes again! Is it a heck of a lot cheaper? Yes! Keep things in perspective and you will probably find your experience to be better than those who are giving low reviews. I have stayed at the Congress several times, mostly for business. This last trip, however, was with my family during a short vacation. I will admit I was nervous about bringing my wife and kids to the Congress. It is not as fancy as other local options and I have had my share of 'interesting' experiences there. Price considerations won out in the end and we booked our room. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a two bedroom corner suite (without asking!) that offered a wonderful view of the city. It was quiet and clean even if dated. The linens were nice and the usual hotel room fare was present-coffee maker, iron, flat screen tvs (one in each room). There was also a large walk-in closet with a safe. There were ample electric outlets for all our gadgets. Among the best things about the Congress are the price and the location. We had the valet park our car and never used it during the length of our stay. We walked or used a public transportation pass for everything we did. The location of the hotel allowed us to walk to several of the museums and there are bus stops everywhere. Navigation from the Congress is no problem. The lower price of the room compared to the other similarly located hotels was great. Is the Congress worthy of 5 stars? Not by a long shot. Service can be spotty. The decor and upkeep is sub par. Dining options are limited and overpriced. They have an unfriendly internet access policy ($10 plus tax per day for wired access in the room and another $7.50 plus tax for wireless in the lobby). What they do offer in price, location, and a clean place to sleep is worth 3 stars, however. If you are considering the Congress you should determine what you are willing to sacrifice for the lower cost. If you want the best accommodations in Chicago then go somewhere else. If you want a decent, affordable place to sleep while you explore the city then the Congress may well be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Poor old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shasta M
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my wife with a trip to Chicago for St. Patrick's Day. I wanted to stay downtown near all the festivities, so I looked at The Congress Plaza Hotel. I love history and old buildings. Their website said it was built in 1895, and was once owned by Al Capone. The pictures were very nice, so I booked it, thinking I was getting a classy old hotel. What I really got was an old hotel! When we got to the hotel, I went to the front desk and the woman seemed annoyed that I had the nerve to want to check in at 2:45, as check in isn't until 3:00. After she gave us our room, we hauled our luggage past no less than 5 bellmen, never once were we even asked if we needed assistance. When we found our room, we walked in to a smell that can only be described as dirty. The carpet was filthy and looked like it belonged in a mid70's mobile home! The door on the bathroom had to be the original door from 1895, which would have been ok, except it was cracked the length of it from top to bottom, and had to have at least a quarter inch of paint on it. I pulled out the chair at the small table, sat down, and immediately fell to the floor, hitting the a/c unit on the way down. The chair had been broken before and someone had glued it back together and put it back in the room! My wife called the front desk to tell them of the situation, and while she was on the phone, she sat on the bed and the bed fell through!!! They sent a maintenance man to retrieve the broken chair. When we told him about the bed, he pulled the mattress back and to my surprise there was no boxspring only wooden slats that were held to the sides of what looked like a waterbed frame, with small screws. We checked in and back out in less than an hour! The front desk manager was very polite and understanding, as I'm sure that we were not the first guests to leave as soon as they get to their room. This hotel could be a beautiful old hotel, ala The Peabody. It's too bad that it looks like they gave up on it in the 80's. Unless major restoration happens, I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential yet...”
Reviews.Author: Spurpur
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night in Dec. 2011. The hotel lobby looks like it jumped out of pages of an 80's detective novel. Nice antique looking but with bright neon signs flashing from the bar. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. The room is clean but the paint was peeling and the bathtub probably needs to be replaced (bumps and dents). The king size bed was little be sagging in the middle. Its towels, pillow case, bed sheets... were embroidered with the hotel logo which was kind of nice. The temperature in the room was kind of hard to adjust (hot or freezing... nothing in between) without opening the windows. This hotel, with its history and decor, can be one of the premium hotels in Chicago. You just have to look at the Hilton beside it to see what potential the Congree have. It seems to be living in its past glory for way too long. However, the good thing is that the price of this hotel is reflective of its condition (cheap compare to its neighbors) so good for economical customers.

Reviews.Title: “horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Lorena P
Reviews.Content: i would never go back to this hotel ever. sticky carpet, clogged sink, paint peeling. 20 mins. right after we check in we had to move to another room coz we cannot use the sink. i cannot stand the smell of the carpet. we stayed there 1 night and move to another hotel the next day. we did not sleep the whole night its so hot...receptionist says that they only turn on the AC on summer time. so we decided to open the window but it didnt help at all. pickeeters are annoying too. the only good thing i can say to this hotel is location. i would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Think of it as the coolest youth hostel ever.”
Reviews.Author: travelheaven1
Reviews.Content: It took me a little while to understand this hotel. At first I was put off by the fact that the rooms are so dated - they have no mini fridges, no iPod docks, no fancy bathrooms. They paint is peeling, the carpets are old. But the ceilings are high, maybe 18 feet. The windows are tall, and they open to let air in, which is a treat, honestly. This is not the place you want to take your mother-in-law, not the place you want to take your young kids. But if you're there to goof around with your friends, this may be coolest place in town. It's a little like the hotel in The Shining. There may be weird dead twins on some floors. We went exploring. The stairs are marble, with cast iron rails. Down down you go, and you pop out on a floor that is totally uninhabited, and left to decay. It's surreal. A housekeeping cart is in the hall, as if it were about to be cleaned, or just had been, but not on this floor. One more flight down, and you are deposited into a second floor mezzanine, with unmoving escalators that lead to the main floor. The mezzanine is long abandoned. The lights are out, the mirrors reflecting into infinity. We ran around here like children. No one cared, no security came to usher us out. We took many photos. The hotel is in the heart of the loop. It's easy walking to everything, including all public transportation. It has a really lively bar, with a mixed crowd. Pool tables, lots of cozy seating areas, a digital jukebox. Overall we really enjoyed the creepy mix of old and new, abandoned and occupied. If you think of the rooms as really deluxe youth hostel rooms, rather than mediocre hotel lodgings, you'll have the right frame of mind to enjoy what the Congress Plaza has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Felt bad for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: etrayn1979
Reviews.Content: I checked out of the Congress Plaza today and honestly upon entering the building I felt so sad for the building. I am a minor history buff and LOVED the history of the building and the character and thought is was horrible that the building was not kept up like it should have been. I agree with previous raters in that the moulding needed work, the carpet needs to be taken out, the bed wasn't all that comfortable but honestly it was decent for the price (the bed that is, I've had worse beds in more expensive hotels). I actually wanted to go and get some chemicals to peel off all the paint on my antique bathroom door. I wanted to shine up the doorknob and take all the cracking/peeling paint off of the moulding. The wallpaper needs to be removed and replaced with something similar, something that can maintain the historic character of the building, but something updated. All in all, it was a decent stay. The staff were friendly. Even the picketers were friendly LOL. The lobby was beautiful but could use different lounge chairs/sofas, bright red pleather doesn't do the lobby justice. The mosaics in the building are just beautiful. Even the staircases with wrought iron rails were beautiful and I wanted to take the paint off of them too. If you want a cheaper-ish hotel in a great location this is place. Want to warn those like me though who have asthma/allergy problems that you may not be best situated in this location. The old carpet really messed with my allergies and sinuses. There is a perfumy/musty sort of smell. Luckily there was nice weather so I could open the windows and get some relief. Also the walls are super thin like other people mentioned. I sleep with ear plugs so it didn't bother me and I slept well as long as I took my Claritin-D to keep from getting stuffed up.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bonjour44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend trip. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is across the street from the Buckingham Fountain. We have no complaints about the staff, fast and easy check-in and check-out. We slept well on the beds. The lobby of the hotel is really pretty, but the rooms are needing updated. It is very old and dated. I did love the high ceilings in the room. Door to bathroom in our room needed replaced as it was very hard to open and close. I would recommend this hotel to a friend due to the excellent location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ohioabroad
Reviews.Content: I read many of the one-star reviews and was wary about my stay at Congress Plaza, but I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, it's an old building. Yes, it could use some updating. Yes, there were picketers at times (though they simply went about their business of picketing). However, my room was very clean (much cleaner than some places I've stayed in Chicago for twice the cost) and the bed was quite comfortable. I enjoyed being in an historical building that hadn't been gutted and whitewashed to fit some generic standard. If you want a sparkly hotel with rooms that seem as though you are the first ever to stay in them, this isn't the place for you. If you like a bit of character, then I recommend it. I wish I had ponied up for a room with a view, because it looked like those would be lovely. The location is perfect and easy to get to by L train blue line from the airport. My only real complaint was that all of the reports of no truly hot water were confirmed when I took a shower. The hotel does need to update its plumbing system.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk. Old hotel, bad beds.”
Reviews.Author: ispeakbelgianese
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Don't think the hotel's been updated in the past 30 years and it looks the part. As noted in other reviews, the carpets are disgusting - different colors, etc. The beds are the worst part: awful, you can feel the mattress coils through them. No wifi (seriously, in 2012) so only cable internet at $12 per day. Good location and nice-size rooms but, I would still recommend to skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Kavion
Reviews.Content: The carpets in the room were disgusting. I have the pictures to show it. The hotel seemed to have only a few guests. The rooms were not in the greatest condition. The bed was rigged, again, I have pictures to show it. Hotel staff was awful. Do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room heater would not shut off with thermastat. I had to turn off heater and open window to cool off room. Outside noise too loud to sleep. Mattress was unconfortable Room was clean but was not updated.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upkeep”
Reviews.Author: Jenna G
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to stay in a historic hotel like this one if it was maintained. We had no air circulation in our room. The molding above the door in the bathroom was missing, and the door frame was cracked. The water took about 5 or 10 minutes to heat up. The walls were paper thin, and I got stuck listening to a crying baby for 2 nights. Also, I came back one evening to discover my door had been left open by housekeeping for nearly 5 hours. Luckily, nothing was taken, but I was very disappointed in such carelessness. Overall, an awful experience and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mstwinmommy
Reviews.Content: With all the negative reviews, I was just praying that they wouldn't be true. Just came back and we had a family suite for 180 a night great price and location. You can tell that it is old, but there were updates and we were impressed, all 30 something professional women traveling with our children ages 4 to 16. The staff was all friendly and helpful and all future trips to Chicago will be here. The shower water wasn't hot but it was a comfortable warm, not as bad as the reviews say.

Reviews.Title: “'Terrible' doesn't even begin to cover it.”
Reviews.Author: nmh885
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are on our third night of staying here. Thankfully we are checking out tomorrow. The shower doesn't warm up, and we may as well take baths because the tub doesn't drain. The room is either hot or cold- there seems to be no in between. You can hear a constant stream of traffic, horns, sirens, and trains all day and night. This doesn't really bother me but might be a con for others looking for a hotel in the area. The hotel is grungy and definitely needs some renovations. The best part is the paper thin walls. During this stay we have been blessed with next door neighbors that like to get down and dirty at all hours of the night, at least three times per night. Kudos to them but not so great for those of us who don't want to listen to someone moaning all night long. Overall, worst hotel I've ever stayed in. If I had it to do over again, I would have spent a little more money and stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet evening”
Reviews.Author: lkahn
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a quick overnight and wanted to be downtown so we chose the congress. We managed to get an inexpensive very quiet room with a tiny view of the river. Everything is a bit run down but the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. We loved all the beautiful architecture the high ceilings and the size of the place. The staff was very nice. The hotel does not have any bells and whistles, like a nice gym or jacuzzi tubs but it was great to walk outside and be right on the lake and within walking distance of the museums. It was nice to stay in a little piece of Chicago's history .

Reviews.Title: “Old and shows it...”
Reviews.Author: bristolroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 1/23/12 that was enough. Historic yes, nice no. Shabby in all respects. Water does not get hot, TV sketchy, heating in winter abysmal, service indifferent. Air quality in the room is appalling. Internet slow and erratic $12 a day. Other staying there reported the same. I certainly would never take my wife there. All in all the Chicago convention and tourism should get this off there list.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Mo S
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago during January, 2012 and chose the Congress Plaza for its convenience to the McCormick Center. I was highly disappointed. This place is a dump! Dirty. Cheap finishes. A restaurant that would make Denny's seem nice (the Gazebo Restaurant needs to invest in dishwasher that actually works! And oh yes, a 15 minute wait for hot water. This place is a DUMP! I will not be coming back to the Congress Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: ARTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- good location, easy to catch bus to any location. Easy to walk anywhere on Michigan Ave. Very good price. The rooms are a little old and bathrooms are small. View was great from front side of hotel. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Gloria J
Reviews.Content: Do not let the pictures deceive you. To put it lightly, this place is a dump. It was has not been updated in maybe 10 years and there is a thick layer of dust covering everything is the establishment. The staff are very unfriendly and unprofessional. The toilet was dirty when we checked in and the TV did not work. When maintenance was called about the TV, their advice was to "smack it or unplug it" until it works. Over the course of 2 hours of television program, we had to "smack the TV", 10 separate times. The mattresses were the most uncomfortable hotel mattresses that I have ever slept on. Wi-Fi is an additional $7.50 per day. But the cherry on the top was our discovery on the last day of our stay. Cockroaches rummaging through our room as we packed to check out. This is filthy and not worth your time and money no matter how inexpensive it is. Don't fall for the fake pictures online.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some tlc”
Reviews.Author: GBD11
Reviews.Content: Tagged along on a business trip. First, having to pass the picket lines to get inside was uncomfortable. Was told the strike has been ongoing for ten years. Room was large and quiet, although dated. Didn't really feel that old world charm as listed in other reviews. Someday, it will no doubt reveal more of the grandeur that other buildings have maintained. Staff were all helpful, though. It's a bit beyond the hub of the Golden Mile so if you plan on walking, be prepared. Luckily, Chicago is a great city to explore. Taxis will be required if going out for dinner from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charming”
Reviews.Author: Maggie P
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for business and I like its location. It is clean and comfy. Hotel gave me the idea that they try to renovate without losing the personality. It is easy to make it look with new contemporary furniture and design but this hotel still has original features which make me want to see first years of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, stayed 3 times now!”
Reviews.Author: Pat0913
Reviews.Content: I checked very good because for the money it is the best for the location. I read a lot of these reviews and I was shocked! I have taken my wife and kids there 3 times now and the place is just fine and is safe. It is very old and has not been remodeled but has been kept up very nicely. It has CHARACTER! I am not a prima donna and would never stay in a dump, and we love this place. It is 150 a night for a family of 4 with double beds, the furniture is very old and beautiful! Nice new flat screens! Some hotels in worse locations on Mich Ave are 3-400 a night. This hotel is a 2-3 block walk from Millennium park and 3-4 blocks from Bennagins restaurant (nicer applebees basically) . It is 2 blocks or so from a nice bakehouse for breakfast and a mom and pop breakfast place and dunkin donuts a block maybe. You can walk to Shedd Aquarium if you don't mind a 15-20 minute walk. My son lost a toy in the trash and the room guy searched through the main trash until he found it. Bellman are all nice! In the hotel...Nice bar and restaurant with old wood work and original bar! I will never stay anywhere else in Chicago! It is true the strike is almost 8 years but the hotel does not miss a beat and they only walk 1-2 times a week and do not say a word to you. The strikers get paid well by the union according to the desk lady and can have other jobs so who is at fault here, really? This hotel is GREAT for what you pay and location rocks!!! Oh, it is quiet, Walls are thick like older hotels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic historic hotel in a great location for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: AwwBabyElelphants101
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Chicago hotels and this has been by far my favorite. It is just down the street from Millennium Park and the Art Institute...also, walking distance to Navy Pier and Willis Tower. Also, if you have a car...an easy drive to Science and Industry Museum. The hotel is truly beautiful and historic. It might need some painting in some rooms, but it was very clean and that is all that really matters. Also, surprisingly great food at Rafael Steakhouse!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: Levi O
Reviews.Content: AVOID THE CONGRESS PLAZA HOTEL AT ALL COSTS! We booked our stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel through American Express Travel (powered by Travelocity). The hotel is currently listed on the site as a â€œBest Betâ€� and has been given 3-stars. We ultimately chose to stay there because of its convenient location and fascinating history. When we arrived there, the building architecture was undoubtedly fascinating, it soon became obvious that the hotel is not being properly maintained. Setting the dirty carpets and dark, dirty, hallways aside, our first disturbing discovery was an unlocked door on the 7th floor next to the vending area. This unlocked door opens into a shaft used for plumbing and other infrastructure, however, one, especially, a child, could easily fall down to the lower floors and be seriously injured or killed. It shocks me that the hotel can remain in operation with such serious safety hazards. At approximately 11:20 p.m., we discovered a BED BUG in the bed in one of our rooms! We immediately gathered the evidence, took pictures, and called the front desk. The front desk did not seem surprised by our discovery and acted as if we were inconveniencing them! The front desk sent a security officer to the room at approximately 11:40 p.m., who also did not act surprised. The officer had us fill out a security report and took pictures of the bug. The security officer advised us that the manager will move one room. Since we had three rooms on the floor, two of which were adjoining rooms, we went to the front desk, with the bug, to request that all of our rooms are moved. Again, the night manager acted as if we were inconveniencing him. He first advised us that the hotel was almost to capacity and that we would not get three rooms together on another floor. Like magic, however, the new rooms that we received were all in the same hallway, on the same floor, two of which were again adjoining! We checked our new rooms thouroughly for any bed bugs and did not find any. We then went to bed, but did not get much sleep with the thought that bed bugs could be just feet away. What a way to spend New Yearâ€™s Eve! The next morning, I called American Express Travel to report the issue. After an hour of busy signals and getting disconnected, I eventually spoke with a supervisor, explained the issue, and requested a full refund for our three rooms. The AmEx supervisor called the hotelâ€™s manager on duty, Francine, on a three-way call. Francine said that she would call me back shortly with more information. She never called me back and I went to the front desk to follow-up. She said that she was authorized by the hotelâ€™s general manager, Shakeel Siddiqu to refund one room and I reported that it was unacceptable. We asked her to call Shakeel back and explain the situation again. She went into the office and supposedly called him back, however, I do not believe that she did. She again said that they would refund one room and would need to call American Express Travel to discuss the issue further. I then asked for a copy of the security report that was filed the night before. She told me that the security office would not give her a copy, but they would give me a copy. I proceeded to the security office in the basement of the hotel and was told that they would not give me a copy of the report until it was reviewed by the director of security. The security personnel is a total joke and more concerned with pointing out wrongs in their colleagues than helping customers. They provided the report number only and said that they would fax the report later. I called American Express Travel and spoke with another supervisor, who, again called the hotel and spoke with Francine. He was advised that the hotel would refund one room and it was policy to follow the hotelâ€™s refund policy. I explained bed bugs in our room was completely unacceptable, however, the supervisor proved incompetent and did not understand the situation at all. I hope that American Express Travel and Travelocity performs its own investigation into the Congress Plaza Hotel and removes it from their sites so that others do not have to experience what we did. Ultimately, it is obvious that the hotelâ€™s lack of concern for its guests stems directly from the hotelâ€™s shady owners and all the way through the incompetent management. I do not think a single member of their staff has any idea was customer service is. I also doubt they know they are working in a service industry! After checking out of the hotel, I performed some due dilligence on the hotel. I wish I would have done so before our stay, rather than trusting American Express Travel. I found that our story is not by any means new or isolated. Members of UNITE HERE Local 1 working at the Congress Hotel have been on strike since 2003 after the hotel decided to freeze wages and slash benefit. The Congress Plaza Hotel simply does not care about its guests or employees. The hotel, its owners, and its management are a disgrace to Chicago, the State of Illinois, and those that choose to run ethical businesses across the United States. This is evidenced by the unwillingness to put an end to the strike and the abundance of other reviews on the Internet. AVOID THE CONGRESS PLAZA HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “Can't stop chuckling”
Reviews.Author: poopsiebaby
Reviews.Content: Let's just say that I'm glad that I spent most of my holiday in Chicago actively visiting museums, going on tours, shopping etc. This is not the hotel for people who spend a lot of time in their rooms. I agree with others that the room reeked of cleaning fluids, yet was grimey around baseboards. The air conditioning unit was covered in mold/mildew. The bathroom looked like it had recently been updated but it looked like I did the tiling job (not a good thing). The shampoo and conditioner containers were half full when I checked in. I laughed and just put up with the faults because I convinced myself that the price was somewhat of a bargain. The bed looked clean and I hope that it was! The biggest chuckle was the takeout food containers that someone had left on a window ledge in the hallway and remained there for a day or two. Other than that, the hotel was in a good location and you can walk to any of the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “History Awaits”
Reviews.Author: Emily D
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here with some apprehension after reading multiple reviews...negative and positive. But, the price was right, so that's why I chose to stay at the Congress Hotel. Noisy? Kind of, but it's downtown Chicago and with a city comes noise. Personally, I think it adds to the experience. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. My friend and I arrived before our check-in time, but they already had our room ready, so we were able to drop our luggage off and get settled in...no problems. Definite plus! As far as the hotel being dated, I found that to be charming. It's an old hotel, full of history, so the little out-dated things here and there were fine with me. Comes with the territory. The view from my hotel room's window was great, and, no, I didn't have a lake view, just the city. If you're on a budget, but you want to stay in the downtown area, I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, no frills, extra $49 for early check-in.”
Reviews.Author: nodedet
Reviews.Content: No question this place could use renovation. It's not fancy, but it's functional. The major annoyance was being charged an extra $49 for checking in early (before 11 am.) I didn't request this in advance so it's not as if they made up the room early especially for me. Location is very good, walking distance to many major points of interest and 1 block from Metra train. At $158 a night, this is a reasonable value for a city hotel. --I had no problem with hot water or water pressure, even at 10-11 pm. The bathroom was clean. The bed was clean and comfortable. Room included: flat screen TV, room safe, and hair dryer. To my disappointment, no mini-fridge or coffee maker. No central air but the room unit was quiet enough.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best”
Reviews.Author: BarbraYoung1945
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very old feeling to it. The rooms are not really up to date but the good thing about the hotel is where it's located. It's right in the middle of town and and a great view of ,the lake. My children loved the historic feel of the hotel, and I loved the price. It's decent for the pricing. Just needs a little remodeling. Staff is some what pleasant Just need to get them at the right time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, if that's what you look for”
Reviews.Author: yesmasterjedi
Reviews.Content: Staff are unkind and they don't even look to the face in check in/out dialogue. Rooms are like the hotel, they are old. Newly furnished but even the doors are seems like one hundred years old. Don't expect a fridge or complimentary water.. You have your tv, bed and coffee machine.. No free wireless Internet. Average hotel with average price in a very good location. Close to "bean" , "loop" and Michigan avenue.. All in walking distance. For a short stay, I recommend this hotel but not for long..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very historic feel”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the location, kind of right in the middle of the tourist area, we has a great view of the lake and Navy Pier. We also liked that our room was just not a square box but had a shape to it. There were places that you can see that age and lack of upkeep has taken its toll on the place. Our room looked like it hadn't got a fresh coat of paint in years. Also it seemed as though we had to walk forever to get to our room. Overall I would stay here again. If you are there ask to see the Gold Room, it is worth the time. We got a nice escort from a guard that added a little humor to our tour of the Gold Room.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime.”
Reviews.Author: jbranton777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on the reviews and the close proximity to McCormick Place Convention Center. Many years ago this place must have been magnificent but now it is badly in need of an update. The bed was comfortable enough, but that was the high point of the stay. The bathroom was tiny and in my opinion inadequate for the price point. The service in the restaurants was mediocre at best and the food followed suit. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Congress Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lansing56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to shopping and restaurants. Many attractions are within walking distance. This is an old historic hotel. Although the architecture is interesting, it appeared dirty and in ill repair. We did not try the restaurants on site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: Bewickwren
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Congress Plaza in Chicago after a trip from California on the California Zephyr. The positives for us were the price and location. The many negative comments gave us pause, but after reading other comments concerning the picket line and that many of the negative reviews might be bogus, we went ahead and stayed two nights. We had an excellent stay. We would stay there again and highly recommend the Congress Plaza. It is very convenient to Union Station-an $8 cab ride took us to the door. There was a picket line at the main door but there was never an issue or confrontation. If not crossing a picket line is important to you choose another hotel. This is an older hotel and it looks it, but it is clean and well kept. It has a beautiful large lobby with plenty of places to sit. There are many other â€œnooks and cranniesâ€� with comfortable chairs. The room itself was large and clean. We paid a bit extra for a â€œlake viewâ€� and were glad we did. The Congress Plaza is well located to most of the major attractions. We walked to the Art Institute and could see most of the other major museums from our room. Based on our experience I believe that many of the negative reviews are not from people who actually stayed here, but are a result of the labor action. The Congress Plaza is inexpensive and well located. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: M E
Reviews.Content: Worst room I've ever seen. ever. Had reserved four nights for the chicago marathon weekend. Told front desk I would be checking out the next morning as they would not refund my first night. The woman at the front desk told me it was no problem. I then went a block down to the hilton. beautiful. Stayed there for the next four days. A month later a charge shows up on my credit card for four more nights. After speaking with the hotel they advised that a refund would be no problem. A week later they had not refunded. I spoke again this time to the manager and subsequently to the president who basically said I was lying to them and that house keeping had records and so did security of me using the room. They would not give me the refund. I have proof I stayed at the hilton. It is a sad day when a hotel like this can get away with fraud. Travelers be ware. The website misrepresents the hotel. It is no where near what it appears to be. The rooms are terrible. They smell bad, they are dismal, and the furniture appears to have been purchased at a yard sale in the 1960's. Its beaten up and crappy. Beware of fraudulent charges.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: AndreErasmus
Reviews.Content: This grand old lady needs more than botox - a major refit or facelift is required. They say 15 US presidents have used it and so too, apparently, did Al Capone. Maybe they weren't fussy or the last presidential visit was some decades ago. The rooms are just adequate but tired, decor starting to get shabby. Food service was barely adequate, staff were seemingly untrained (some were on strike and picketing outside the front door,so this could be part of the problem). There's much ado about the 'gold room' and posters saying it was worth a vist. Well, it closed during my stay. Only one elevator for the even-numbered rooms worked most of the time I was there. It's saving grace is its location opposite the park, proximity to downtown (for better food) and the convention centre. Also had hassles withy my bill, just to top it all.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Our room overlooked Grant Park and was large comfortable and could not be faulted. Loved the decor and the foyer/bar area worked a treat. Food was fairly average but overall a well located hotel from which to visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: DZalumni
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing this hotel has going for it is its location on Michigan Avenue. Hotel rooms are old, run down and yuckie. I wouldn't stay here again. Beds were nice and staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Congress Plaza...never again!”
Reviews.Author: JMGK M
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Congress to take advantage of a contract they had with a race that was being held in the city. Was also hosting out of town company, so looking to provide an enjoyable experience. When I booked the room, I requested one of the renovated rooms. The receptionist told me that they have all been renovated. When??? The decor and mattress had to be at least 25 yrs old!! We paid more than $50 for early check in so that we could shower up after the race. Early check in was 10:00, but when we arrived at 11:30, we had to wait at least 20 minutes for the receptionist to even find us a clean room!! What would have happened if we did arrive at 10:00?? There were no apologies offered at all. The room was way too hot and dry. We had our window opened as much as we could for our entire stay...in NOVEMBER in CHICAGO! By the time we left, I felt like my skin was going to crack off. Our request for clean towels took two phone calls and over two hours. The front desk staff was not friendly at all. You had to be a body builder to be strong enough to flush the toilet. I will NEVER stay at this location again nor will I recommend it to anyone. I'm all for historic Chicago hotels, but most of them are truly renovated to offer modern amenities while maintaining charm. The Congress should take notes from such establishments. I have paid less and stayed at far better historic hotels in the city. Thumbs DOWN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Hotel from The Shining Movie---am I a ghost?”
Reviews.Author: Igetsaround
Reviews.Content: Did I see a ghost? This place is old and creepy. Yes it was built in the 1800s but a little word called upgrade goes far. In the room; blood burgundy, ratty, creepy old carpeting. How unsightly. The 1930s wallpaper matches the drapes. I mean it's the same ugly antique pattern. The doors don't close because they've been painted over and over and I think they're the originals from the 1800s. Bathroom door wouldn't close. The "closet" looked like a creepy killing booth. There is a CHAIN ON THE MAIN ENTRY DOOR!!!! Creepy. The furniture is so plywood.com! Come on! The thin, cheap, spring-in-your-back bed doesn't even fit the flimsy platform plywood bed. I felt like I was on a set of a scary movie. I literally slept with all lights on and all doors closed. My view: a fire escape although I asked for a view of Grant park. I needed to see civilization. Who would I scream at when the ghosts come? The hotel: when people are present the place is not to creepy. But once you get up on the floors, after riding the original elevator up, where is everyone? And there's that creepy ol blood burgundy carpet and down this dimly lit hallway. The lobby is so fricking old. Again, this hotel reminds you of the abandon hotel on The Shining. What's good? Your on Michigan Ave, you have protection from the weather and the buffalo wings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: jrwinjapan
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but very clean, comfortable with wonderful views. Staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WEBSITE DECEIVING!”
Reviews.Author: Xray04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11/4/11 for the weekend. I am never one to complain and I usually make the best of any mediocre or sub par situation, i think trips are what you make them with your attitude, but this hotel was awful for the price. Long story, but we got 2 nights at the hotel from a friend who couldn't make the trip. That being said it was ok since we paid half of what he paid for it. At $170 a night for two people (before taxes/fees), I was appalled by the experience. I have stayed at nicer hotels on Michigan Ave. for cheaper and with better amenities for the price. I can't believe what hotels think they can get away with. We had a double room on the top floor, it was tiny and felt like a dorm. The view was an interior room of the other side of the north tower we were in. There were two beds when clearly in the past this room was made for one bed. The bathroom door wouldn't even open all the way from the bed being in the way. Our room was so hot, it was unbearably uncomfortable. Maybe it is common, but I have been in hundreds of hotels and have never had a room where you couldn't choose between having AC or heat. I realize this hotel is old (it definitely needs updates) but the entire hotel was set for heat. Our window only opened 2 inches and we had to keep the room door open whenever we were in the room just so we wouldn't be smothered by the temperature. For the cost you think you could get something nice out of it. Asking for a fridge was extra. Internet was $11 a day. Room service was average and overpriced, not available late at night, and are subject to 11% tax, added gratuity, and a delivery charge! I just hate added fees. One elevator was broken. The other was slow and fit 6 people max. It took forever waiting to get from the 12th floor to the lobby or vice versa. The mattress and bedding was the cheapest I've experienced at any hotel. You could feel every spring and the linens were scratchy and thin (not that you needed them to stay warm). The official website for this hotel is EXTREMELY deceiving!!! It looks like the pictures for this hotel were taken 30 yrs ago. The same could be said about the pictures the hotel features on its postcards, in room service binders, and room keycards. The furniture is not the same even in the lobby. The furnishings and decor do not match the styling or updates made decades ago. Parking was $28 a day not included in the nightly rate. Nuff said. Only pros: location right on Michigan Ave, flat screen tv, clean room/bathroom, nice concierge. This hotel definitely charges enough to do some major revamping/updating. They need to invest in restoring the beauty of this old hotel. The charm is just not there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location only”
Reviews.Author: Aitch4Naperville
Reviews.Content: This location is a great location for any activities near Grant Park and Millenium Park. However, the hotel rooms, restaurants, and lobby are very outdated. The hallways are dark, older carpet and older elevators. I would only stay here if you needed location only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Iconic hotel”
Reviews.Author: perth45
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights...the hotel rooms may be a little on the tired side, but nevertheless was clean, very comfortable and spacious. We were lucky enough to see the 'Gold room'....the hotels old ballroom, it was wonderful and exuded charm and an historic sense of occasion. The foyer/ reception/ bare were also nice. It wasn't expensive and great location, near Buckingham fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashion, but central and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: sweber24
Reviews.Content: This large hotel, or were the room only large?, was truly a magnificent Hotel in the good old days, but these days, I would have expected a more modern equipped room and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let the picketers fool you!”
Reviews.Author: dnickley
Reviews.Content: So i actually used to go to school next door to this hotel for years. And i always thought that it was going to be a run down hotel since there are always picketers outside. But i had a deal to stay here for a couple nights and i was pleasantly surprised when we got in. The reception area is BEAUTIFUL! and the rooms are so cool. It's an old hotel but has been very well kept. Awesome old features throughout the whole hotel. The location is so perfect too. our view overlooked the park. it was awesome! i would def stay here again and i tell all my friends and family about it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: MomtoPDandL
Reviews.Content: We were only in the hotel for two nights in October so it was not a long stay but we were pleased with the hotel, location, staff and room. We checked in on a Friday night and the staff was picketing right out front of the hotel and we had to walk through them to get in. When we pulled in there were about 5 - 8 cars waiting to be valet parked and no valet. I checked at the front desk and was told to leave the car in the street and they would take care of it. We did and our car was taken care of fine. We did stayed for two nights but did not eat in the hotel so I cant comment on the restaurants. Our room was fine we had two adults and two kids so we had two double beds. The beds were fine and the room was larger than I had expected. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. We had a fax sent to the main desk and we received a call right away that it was there and ready to be picked up. I liked the hotel and would definately stay there again, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time...”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago October 20-23...The room was very clean, house keeping was very nice and attentive...we were needy...wanted a fridge, needed more pillows...etc...they were right on it. Had cocktails in the bar and restaurant...GREAT SERVICE! Had Breakfast Sunday morning and the hostess was great..the service was a bit slow...we ordered off of the menu instead of having the buffet and it was very good. Thank you Congress for helping to make our vacation worry free and fun!!! :) Oh and the view of Buckingham Fountain and the lake was FANTASTIC---Was able to watch the sunrise from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but needs some reforms”
Reviews.Author: Hodoiporos
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, and the room is good enough. The hotel is reasonably well taken care of, though not impeccable. The staff is very professional, though not especially warm. I found the hotel a little overpriced, but the location may account for that.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LVWOLF
Reviews.Content: I will start with a positive for this hotel-the location. We stayed at the Congress because of the proximity to Grant Park and the Chicago Marathon. We basically had to only walk approximately 1/4 of mile to reach the start and finish of the race. Also, it's on Michigan Avenue which is close to the Chicago Art Museum, Millennium Park and many restaurants. Here's why I consider the Congress Hotel a poor option-it's old and needs a serious makeover. We stayed in the North tower and I felt like I was staying in a decrepit weekly motel. Everything from the old floor boards, rotting door trim, the musty hallway carpeting to the wires hanging out from the flat screen TV, all screamed "shabby." Also the service was below par, other than the maids and door men. Many of the employees seemed to have an attitude, i.e. one front desk clerk appeared annoyed that we asked for change for a $20 bill. A bartender didn't even bother look up when asked a simple question about where the vending machines were in the hotel. When he did so, he had a sarcastic reply. Sadly, the Congress could be an awesome hotel with its history and location. However, it appears that its ownership/management is underperforming. Again, this place would be suitable for a 1 night stay if you are running the marathon. It is quiet in the evening. However, anything more than that would only cause you to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of a great location”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: This place has a great location, and the building has an awesome historic feel. Unfortunately those are the only positive things I can say about the Congress Plaza. The service, in a word, sucks (ok, except maybe the maid- she did a nice job). Staff is unfriendly, typical wait to park or retrieve a car at the valet was 30 minutes. Striking workers means you have to cross a picket line to enter or exit. Food was shoddy, every department was woefully understaffed. Amenities are all very outdated. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Congress Plaza and definitely regret the choice. We "upgraded" to a lake view, and, while the view was very nice, the rest of the stay was not. The bed was terrible--we could feel every spring in the mattress. This mattress started it's life as a cheap one, and you can only imagine how bad it is probably 10 years later. All the poorly-done details stood out so much it was hard to overlook the room's many faults: loud fan in the heater/AC unit, chipped paint throughout, bathroom door wouldn't shut, poorly-fitted ceramic tile "fixed" by wide grout lines and globby caulk to fill in the gaps, wallpaper seams lifting, cheap uncomfortable pillows, etc etc. The room was really stuffy, and it took a major effort to get the windows raised. The halls and room stunk of cheap-smelling disinfectant. The tub was a cheap fiberglass model. Detail after detail just plain disappointed us. For breakfast we went to the hotel's restaurant. The food was so-so, and the staff seemed dejected. The bathroom down the hall from the restaurant was creepy: used paper towels were strewn on the floor and even on the sink counters. I can't imagine a staff person had looked at the bathroom in the last day! Finally, we never would have stayed had we not already paid: a large group carrying picket signs circled around the front entry. When I mentioned the labor dispute on checking in, we were told "don't worry, the hotel is fully-staffed." Maybe they should settle the labor issue and bring them back! On checking out we complained and were issued a $50 refund. This was no compensation for an overpriced ($239/night) room. My advice to all: stay away from this place! One block away is the Renaissance Blackstone for basically the same price. It is a far superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: Kelder222
Reviews.Content: No AC this place is awful. Windows open only 3 inches. Bathroom tiles are drywall screwed to the wall and they used liquid nails for grout. Shoty work and unfriendly staff The also lied and said no one was unhappy as they were getting complaints by phone in front if us. Hotel resturant has poor quality food and bad wait service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for Chicago Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the Congress Plaza Hotel because of the location for the Chicago Marathon. Wow, it was perfect!!! I woke up at 6:00 a.m., walked out of hotel at 6:45 a.m. and was standing in line at 7:00 a.m. in time for a 7:30 a.m. start. Perfect!!! This hotel is in walking distance to everything. We walked to the McCormick Convention Center for the race packet pickup, we walked to the History Museum, and the Shedd Aquarium, and we even walked to the Navy Pier all from our hotel. The hotel is older and has the smells that might come with an older hotel, but our room was clean, the beds were comfortable and we had a nice flat screen TV. If you are looking for a convenient location for a race like the Chicago Marathon and want to be near Grant Park, and all that this area has to offer I highly suggest this hotel. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and accommadating.

Reviews.Title: “Start of Route 66”
Reviews.Author: Sheila E
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in good location and reasonably priced. Nearest hotel to start of Route 66 in Adams Street which is why we picked it.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Nostalgiaa nd Know Waht to Expect”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorACB
Reviews.Content: As I noted in all of my reviews. I travel for a living and stay in a lot of hotels in every class from Comfort Inns up to Hyatt Regency. I feel obligated to TripAdvisor to help with meaningful reviews since the reviews on this site have helped me so much. Regarding the Congress Plaza Hotel in Chicago. My advice is to know upfront what you are getting. The hotel was originally built in the late 1800s and enlarged in the early 1900s and it shows. The rooms are fairly large and the ceiling very high. The property in general is in need of a full renovation. It is relatively clean but the condition of the rugs, wall paper etc. is tawdry. My two biggest complaints relative to the rooms is that they do not have AC rather the cold water and fan approach to cooling the space. This is not comfortable at all. My next complaint relates to may age (65 by the way) and the bathrooms. The lack grab handles for support and the toilets are the lowest of any hotel I have been at. With an ever aging population it is difficult to say the least to stoop so low and then get up with any sense of balance. This will not matter to younger people but anyone over 55 will know how much this means. The staff is okay but nothing special in terms of customer service. On the plus side, the location is outstanding and right on Michigan Ave. I was so displeased with the experience that I left a night early even though the room and parking had been paid for in advance by one of my clients. If you like really old properties and the limitations do not resonate with you then be my (their) guest but if you are over 55 do not come back and say I did not warn you my brothers and sisters for TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Lakefront view”
Reviews.Author: Dragonslayer48073
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Chicago and joined the Army on my 18th Birthday. Upon retiring from the Army, I came home for a Visit. I always wanted to experience a hotel with a lakefront view. I was on the 13th Floor of the Congress Hotel, lakeside view and the view was overwhelming. We witnessed great sun rises, awesome view of the park. To the North, we could see Navy Pier, to the South we saw the Shedd Aquarium. We saw fireworks on the lake in our room. in a word, SPECTACULAR!! The room and staff were great. the hotel location convient to all sights and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great For A Really Low Low Price”
Reviews.Author: lborn724
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome if you spent less then a hundred dollars to stay there. Anything more, and you are better off spending the extra cash. The location is decent, directly across from Millenium Park and on the south end of Michigan Ave. On a nice day, great shopping, restaurants, and sight-seeing are within walking distance. Directly adjacent to the hotel is another story. The check in process is fine if you don't use the check in kiosk. I went through five minutes of prompts before the machine informed me it was not able to make my key and I would need to see someone at the front desk. At the front desk I was again asked to show my ID and credit card (this time they also made a manual rubbing of my card, which I thought was redundant and outdated). After we received the key we went up to the room to set down the luggage. The room has high ceiling giving it an open feeling. However, some negatives are, the closet door squeaked badly when opened, the bathroom door would not latch and lock into place, the toilet ran constantly making a loud flushing-like noise every twenty minutes or so, when the toilet was flushed it rarely ever completed the flush, the air conditioner remained on hi the entire time during our three days there and the room never went below 70 degrees, and both mornings there was no hot water available for a shower. Furthermore the main doors had no peepholes, and only one locking option a pitiful chain that was hardly secured into the door frame. One morning we kept the "do not disturb" sign in the lock so that the maid wouldn't come in. When we had returned we noticed the sign gone and that the maid had been in the room. When we used the bathroom we discovered that during her cleaning she had dropped a bar of soap in the toilet and it had become stuck to the side. The room also had only one accessible plug. If one needed to iron and charge a phone at the same time it required unplugging on of the three table lamps that lit the entire room. If you reserve a lake view room do it for floor 6 and up. Our lakeview room had very little view of the lake, mostly just a portion of Millenium Park.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: AshlieW
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about frills and such this place is GREAT for its location and price! I have stayed here with my 3 girlfriends for the last 2 years! I am not one to stay at anything seedy or sketchy, so this review you can take to the bank. the hotel looks a bit like the hotel from the Stephen King movie the Shining but who wouldn't want to stay there!!?? all in all I love this hotel and WILL be staying here again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an absolutely fantastic location. It is within walking distance of the lakefront and most of downtown. It is also very close to trains and buses to get you wherever else you need to go in Chicago. It is older, but our room was still very nice. The breakfast buffet at the Gazebo restaurant onsite is good as well as the bar just off the lobby. The only downside was that we were on the back side of the hotel and were woken up at 4am our last night by the garbage truck emptying the dumpsters. Overall though it was a great place to stay and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Evan P
Reviews.Content: The Congress was in the perfect spot for our stay. We went for an extended weekend and arrived in Chicago at 8 AM. We took the "L" to the Adams stop, about 4 blocks away, and walked to the hotel. The lady at the front desk pointed us to the concierge who stored our bags while we went to get breakfast and ride bikes around the lake until early check in at 12 noon. She also suggested a few places for breakfast. Our room was fully up to date with brand new fixtures but it was clean and nice enough. It looked directly out at Buckingham Fountain, the lake and the rest of the city - Great view! Throughout the stay we were asking the front desk for help and suggestions and each time they were over the top helpful. We checked out at 4 am and in our half awake state my wife left some clothes in the closet. While we were at the airport we tried calling numerous times before the cleaning staff went in. No one answered. We called when we arrived home and no one answered until approximately 11 am. Finally my wife talked to the security desk and asked them to check the room. They said nothing was left and it was possible it was put with the laundry since the staff that cleaned the room had only been there one or two days. As it turns it the clothes were found "with the dirty laundry" and returned to us. Overall our stay was very nice. The location was the best part!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: This hotel probably used to be nice in its day, but now its in dire need of some upkeep. Location was only good for access to the park and Solder Field, other than that not much better than a travel lodge. The toilet and shower were continuously blocking and had to ask for this to be cleared every day. The breakfast restaurant service was extremely poor and waitress was rude and had to ask for things to be provided to us. Food qualityl was basic and not recommended. There were always people outside striking which was very offputting when trying to gain access to the hotel. There was no wifi access and internet could only be gained by cable in the room at a charge which is shocking for a modern day hotel. Overall we shall not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, remember what you paid.”
Reviews.Author: Jtrak3
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing... Congress Plaza is in a PRIME location. With Buckingham Fountain right out front and walking distance to the Field Museum, Willis (Sears) Tower, and Downtown it's perfect. Only cabs we took: to/from the airport, Wrigley, and the Zoo. I say remember what you paid because it's a freaking steal for the locations. It's an average, large hotel. The room was clean, yeah its old..(if you are offended by 60's wall paper, you shouldn't book it). A clean, modern bathroom (no mold) and cleaned every day. The beds were decent, the sheets were clean. The baseboards had been recently replaced but not painted yet (big deal). If you are looking for luxury... go else where and pay more! If you want location and don't plan to do anything but sleep ... book it! The hotel is one of the oldest in the city and it needs updating which they are doing!

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: DCMate
Reviews.Content: It is an old (probably never renovated) hotel. The rooms are very decent. The breakfast buffet is OK, but you can eat an awesome breakfast a block from the hotel at any cafe for cheaper. Now, the locations of this hotel is great. Walking distance to the art institute, Millennium park, magnificent mile and even the Navy Pier. We could see grant park from our room and also the lake, so it had a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, clean, great views!”
Reviews.Author: Lancerlotsgirl
Reviews.Content: Had read many terrible reviews of this hotel and found none of them accurate for our trip. Check in was simple and quick. We were on the 11th floor and had a beautiful view of the lake and Grant Park. The rooms are definitely dated, but somehow charming. Yes, the wallpaper was peeling in spots and the paint chipped, but it was very clean and neat. We found no bugs, no mold, and no ghosts. Our friends stayed on the 6th floor and also had no complaints. The lobby, restaurants, and bar area were clean and very nice. It's not a 5 star, but for the price, a very solid 3. There were strikers but even though we were in and out many times in our weekend, they never even spoke to us. It was a great location and fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Building is old, musty rooms”
Reviews.Author: DenverDude12
Reviews.Content: We paid $200/ night and not worth it. Very old, dingy rooms that they have tried to remodel best they could. Water slow to come out of pipes, rooms smell like Smoking Rooms from the 1960's. Look a little more North up Michigan Ave would be my suggestion. Dk

Reviews.Title: “Nice location,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jsrf
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. For the price,we were satisfied. Hotel is very beautiful Rooms are very old, but it seems to grow on you. We stayed for 4 days.No major complaints. Great location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Grocamarillo
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. I couln't stay and had to fin another hotel in the middle of the night. The room was dirty with bugs in the bed and bathroom. Simply terrible and when talking to the manager I received a bad attitude. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Not Business Traveler Friendly; Antiquated Check-In; Strikers”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed. This once was a great hotel, but is so no longer, based upon our experience. We stayed here primarily because of location and the fact that most of the other near-by hotels had no rooms available that day . Location is great, but check-in was a problem. Entrance to hotel often was partially blocked by strikers (an 8 year old situation the strikers claimed). After a 10 minute wait in check-in line (only one clerk available, not many people in line), the front desk clerk was unable to find our reservation in her systemâ€¦even though I showed her an e-mail with reservation number and date on it. After about another 30 minutes (and a trip to the managerâ€™s office) she â€œfoundâ€� our reservation. Apparently the reservation system and the front desk computers do not always communicate well. She admitted that this happens occasionally, but is not the norm- an old computer system was blamed. She was very nice though (as were most of the staff) and gave us a (presumably upgraded) room with a view of Grant Park ( which was a great view!). The room was large with a very high ceiling, tastefully decorated and looked clean and well-maintained. There was a wall mounted flat panel TV that seemed a bit too small (32â€�?) for this large of a room. There was no desk, but there was a small table that could make doâ€¦.if one did not mind running internet cable from TV and unplugging coffee maker to plug in computer. The room looked to be recently remodeled, but had not quite been completed , leaving an ancient banged up air conditioning cabinet ( covering a window unit that had a fan control, but no obvious thermostat) and at least one part of trim painted a different color. There was a large walk-in closet with surprisingly little space to hang anything. There were no collapsible luggage racks â€“ just a permanent one built into closet & reducing usable hanger space. The beds were OK, but nowhere near as comfortable those found in Starwood hotels as well as in most Hiltons and Marriotts. There was plenty of hot water and great water pressure. Amenities (soap, shampoo) were minimal and brand-less. There was very little flat space to put anything in the bathroom. It took 20 minutes to get car mid-day even though no one else seemed to be using valet service at the time. I would not recommend staying here unless you can tolerate strike lines, erratic check in and slow car-valet serviceâ€¦. and you could get room for less than about $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but”
Reviews.Author: jesfire415
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, but that really the only upside of this hotel. The price was good. The hot water would only get warm. The weights in the workout area had rust and were Not maintained. The wireless internet was ONLY in the lobby and it not free.Some of the workers were on strike and picking.The room was not comfortable because of the temp. I will NOT return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “"Old" Congress Plaza Hotel- Grant Park”
Reviews.Author: Laurie A
Reviews.Content: The Hotel as you walk in is actually beautiful. The rooms have a smell of moisture in the air and are very old looking. My friend and I both left Chicago with a cold because the temp in the room was uncontrollable. We will never stay at this Hotel again and we visit Chicago each summer.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: txslk
Reviews.Content: We had a great view from our room. I am not sure we would want to stay in the back, but facing the lake was great.We were on the 8th floor which was nice and quiet. We didn't get to see any ghosts...but maybe next time:)

Reviews.Title: “Management abusing power”
Reviews.Author: freuro2011
Reviews.Content: For a recent business trip to Chicago, I made the grave error of booking my hotel stay at The Congress Plaza Hotelâ€¦.Hereâ€™s where a typical hotel reservation turned into the worst hotel experience ever! In transit to Chicago, I realized I left my wallet at home. Since I had my passport and $300 cash in my pocket, I figured Iâ€™d be fine for the weekend business trip. I boarded the flight to Chicago. Checking in at The Congress, I was told by the front desk clerk that my online reservation was for one night only. I apologized and explained my dilemma- I left my wallet (with credit cards) at home. I offered several options for me to pay for the remaining two nights: Paypal, wire transfer, or calling a friend who can pay for the room using their CC. She responded â€œI have to talk with my manager.â€� Minutes later, the manager comes out and tells the clerk that I have to check out of the hotel next morning. The manager did not discuss the issue with me. The manager did not care to listen to any of my suggested options for payment. Basically, the manager didnâ€™t try to find an acceptable solution for me to stay at The Congress for the weekend. Below is the over two-hour scenario: ME: Please, I am standing here, please talk to me so we can find some kind of solution to resolve the matter.MANAGER: You will not be able to stay at the hotel. Lalalalal. After 30 minutes of back and forth, the clerk says she needs a $50 deposit for the night. I paid the requested deposit, went for dinner, and returned to my room for the evening. The following morning, I called a friend and asked him to go to the hotel website and pay for the room online using the hotel reservation confirmation number. He went the hotel website and paid for the reservation online. At this point I feel the matter has been resolved. I leave my hotel room to take breakfast. After breakfast, I return to my room and discover that I cannot open the door to the room. I go down to the front desk and tell them that I cannot get into my room. I was told by the clerk that the hotel canceled the online payment because it wasnâ€™t paid with my personal credit card. ME: You got to be kidding me?! CLERK: Sorry. You need to talk to my manager.MANAGER: We cannot accept payment if we don't have the CC holder information. (This explanation makes no sense, because hotel reservations are made online all the time.) ME: The payment was accepted and then you canceled it? How would you like me to pay for the room?MANAGER: You can call your friend and ask him to fax a copy of the back and front of his CC, driver license, and a letter stating that he authorizes the payment.ME: Fine. Call to my friend: Hey buddy, they canceled your payment. I explained what the manager is requesting. FRIEND: OMGâ€¦I have my kids and we entering the movie theater and the kids are crying for no reason. I canâ€™t do that right now.ME: Okay, don't worry; Iâ€™ll call someone else. I finally reach another friend, explain the situation, and ask him for help with this ridiculous situation. He agrees to help me, but has to drive to his office for a fax machine. After 45 minutes, my friend calls me and says that all the necessary documentation has been faxed to the hotel. I return to the front desk to speak with the manager and ask, â€œDid you receive the fax from my friend?â€� MANAGER: Yes. I called my friend and thanked him for helping me out of this ridiculous situation. My friend leaves the office. Five 5 minutes later, the manager returns and tells me that he needs another faxed copy of the CC, because it is not signed on the back of the card. Iâ€™m very frustrated now and say â€œYou couldn't tell me that when I asked you if you received the fax? My friend has left his office. I called my friend back, â€œSorry my man! You need to fill out the â€œhotel authorization formâ€� and sign the back of your CC. FRIEND: I left the office! @#* &*!!!!!!!!!. Why didnâ€™t they tell you this before..?ME : Iâ€™m so sorry but they just told me and theyâ€™re threatening to kick me out of the hotel, I donâ€™t have my wallet, my cash is running outâ€¦I truly need your help here.FRIEND: Okâ€¦ I wait for the manager and finally he comes out... MANAGER: I received the letter but it didn't note the precise amount for full payment of the hotel stay. [This is ridiculous, because the final invoice for any hotel reservation is not calculated until check-out due to internet fees, phone charges, snack charges, etc.] With complete embarrassment, I call my friend again and try to explain the nonsense of what the manager is claiming he needs. My friend drives back to his office (2nd time) and re-faxes the letter to the hotel. My friend calls me back to see if everything has been received and is good to go? The clerk is standing in front of me with all the faxes in her hand and says â€œNo, I don't have the fax with signature.â€� ME TO MY FRIEND: The clerk says she doesnâ€™t have the fax with your signature.FRIEND: I sent it. The clerk was misspoke about not receiving the letter with my friendâ€™s signature, and the manager comes out and says â€œI have the signed letter, but the signature on the CC and on the letter isnâ€™t exactly the same. At this point, I lose my temper and started to scream. I said to the manager â€œPut yourself in my situation. Iâ€™ve proposed several different payment options, none of which you accepted; I have contacted two friends, both of whom made payment for this reservation, and you canceled both paymentsâ€¦and you expect me be calm?! Iâ€™ve been down here for two hours trying to resolve this issue!â€� MANAGER: Sir, you are making a scene. Now you are not staying in the hotel. Hotel Security will escort you out of the hotel. I proceeded to the hotel lobby to research alternative hotel arrangements with the small amount of cash I had left in my pocket. HOTEL SECURITY: Sir, you have to leave. ME: Ok, give 5 minutes. Iâ€™m just looking on my i-pad for another hotel, and then Iâ€™ll leave. The Chicago Police arrive. POLICE OFFICER: Do we need to arrest him?HOTEL SECURITY: No. ME: Thank you. I try to explain the situation to the police officer.POLICE OFFICER: You need to leave, and youâ€™re lucky that we are not taking you to jail.2ND POLICE OFFICER: Don't talk. Iâ€™ll go and see the management and know what they are saying. I walked out of The Congress Plaza Hotel, escorted by FOUR Chicago police officers, while the hotel security agent went to retrieve all my belongings and put them outside on the sidewalk! 2ND POLICE OFFICER: Did you pay $50 for the 1 night? Never argue with people of authority; they have power in this country.ME: The room was paid for â€“ the $50 was a deposit last night until I could find another form of payment after I discovered that I forgot my wallet at home. This entire situation was not only humiliating but I also felt I was being discriminated against - I am a foreigner with a heavy accent (French, not that hotel staff could distinguish one accent from another). The Congress Plaza Hotel handled my dilemma from the get go as if I was a criminal. The management made no effort to resolve the issue in a respectful, peaceful, and amenable manner. Instead, the hotel security agent brought my belongings in a trash bag along with my suitcase and dumped it on the sidewalk â€“ in front of a â€œ4-starâ€� hotel â€“ with FOUR Chicago police officers. WHY??? Because a hotel clerk and manager wanted to abuse their title by intimidating and bulldozing a guest who is obviously in a dilemma-leaving his wallet at home.

Reviews.Title: “Warning...Do not make a reservation here...”
Reviews.Author: Alex O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible! The entire management, from the front desk to the general manager, are unprofessional, unhelpful, belligerent, antagonistic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: maioh23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible.my room had 18in between the bed n the wall. Paint peeling, exposed wires. The L outside my window all night. They offer an upgrade but then were sold out of all upgrades because u can only upgrade if staying 1night.awful.....

Reviews.Title: “Step back to 1946”
Reviews.Author: JannyWmm
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for in Chicago! $ 137 per night including taxes. If you just need a bed for a night or two, why not stay at the Congress? It is very conveniently located - right in the center of the loop, across from the Park, the lake. Personnel friendly. When I stepped into the room, I thought that my grandmother probably stayed here in the 40's and nothing had changed since then. 20 foot ceilings, peeling wallpaper, woodwork that has been painted over 50 times in the last 100 years. Bathroom was clean albeit the sink was teeny tiny. Hot water. Quiet. Slept well. TV worked. In a weird way, I appreciated the experience.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY”
Reviews.Author: roadtraveler123
Reviews.Content: I wish I had good things to say; but never stay here. My wife and I have stayed here twice. The first one was bad and we should not have gone back. My wife was back in September 2011 and the hotel placed her in a room with a connecting door. She was suspicious of the lock on the door; but it required a key to lock. She placed her shoes in front of that door as an indicator. When she got back to her room - her shoes had been tossed away from the door and the person who had broken into her room had gone through her suitcase! When she talked to management of the hotel - they were reluctant to give her another hotel room and wouldn't apologize for the break in or the fact that the room staff did not lock the door in bewteen the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: pmulvihi
Reviews.Content: While the historic nature of the hotel is impressive, the stay itself was not great. First and foremost, the bed was HORRIBLE. I mean HORRIBLE. Neither of us slept more than two hours a night because it was so uncomfortable. The water pressure in the shower was less than ideal. If you're like me and you have thick hair, it was time-consuming to rinse all of the shampoo and conditioner out. It was unseasonably cold during my visit and there is no individual heater in the rooms, which means we spent both nights bundled under several layers of blankets as we had no way of regulating the temperature. The concierge was very unhelpful. The plus, it was considerably cheaper then surrounding hotels, it was well within walking distance to virtually everything and the front desk staff was pleasant. Still, if I had to go back, I would spend the extra $50 a night to stay somewhere with a better bed, a better shower and more informed concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay here!! Moldy room!”
Reviews.Author: mplstraveler3
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible. The hotel is so old, and the rooms need serious updating. Our room had MOLD growing all over the ceiling in the bathroom. They "cleaned' it, but refused to offer us a refund or move us to another room. I woke up in the middle of the night and could not breathe...so much mold! The beds are horrible, the water pressure in the bathroom is horrible, and the water took 30 minutes to heat up. Please do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel At A Great Price”
Reviews.Author: lbpnole
Reviews.Content: Michigan Ave? Check! Dtown Chicago location? Check! Comfort + good price? Check! My husband and I stayed here Fri, 9/2 through Mon, 9/5 over the 2011 Labor Day Weekend. Ck-in/ck-out was a breeze (even with the Jazz Festival in town and a line at the desk). Staff was friendly & helpful w/directions. Doorman offered to call us a cab, should we have needed one. Excellent location, too!
