We spent half a day at the Art Institute of Chicago (just down the street/walking distance), were close to the Harrison "L" train stop which we took out to see a Cub's game @ Wrigley Field and out to the Apollo theater/Old Town to see a show and have a steak dinner @ O'Brien's and then ultimately to Midway airport when we left. Our room had a king bed, four fluffy pillows, flat screen TV, internet, table w/two chairs, good sized closet w/a safe, a 3-drawer (large!) dresser & desk. Bathroom was a good size (tiny bit of mold though). Yes - this hotel is a part of Chicago history (built in 1893) - if' you're looking for a brand new hotel, this may not be the place for you - but if you're looking for a place with character that reminds you of London or Paris... check out the Congress Plaza next time you're in Chicago. Walk down the street for an expresso, pass by the Buckingham Fountain in Grrant Park and spend your morning at one of the museums (yes... reminds me of London or Paris).

Reviews.Title: “great lake view room and staff”
Reviews.Author: L N
Reviews.Content: stayed over labor day weekend, old world architecture very high celings and a closet deep enough to store 2 mountain bikes! We got a lake view room, stay 11th floor or above, your right there across from grant park and the lake shore paths. Staff was excellent. I think people shun this hotel becausee of union pickets (for last 8 years). If you pick the lakeview room set you will enjoy if you are an outdoor type. If your just a shopper this is not your place. Breakfeast room service excellent or be up earlyy for great outdoor seating a short walk away. We will be back for any waterfront experience we need.

Reviews.Title: “Total Dump”
Reviews.Author: gidget18_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a total dump and completely over priced for what it is. There were cock roaches in the lobby and bed bugs in the bed. The rooms are in very sad shape and dirty. When we told the manager that we were not staying and we wanted our prepaid weekend refunded they refused. We ended up staying one block away at the Hilton for just $7 more a night and a total night and day experience from service to overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay here”
Reviews.Author: cvega
Reviews.Content: What a dump. It may be a good location....but spend $20 or $30 more and stay at a nicer hotel. Checked in, they tried putting me in a room that was HORRIBLE. Paint peeling from the walls & ceiling, and the room just smelled.....bad. Was put into another room with a nice view, HOWEVER, the air conditioning sucked, the bathrooms are tiny, and upon looking over my bed, my sheets had a stain on them! Also, the walls of this hotel must be made of paper maiche....you can hear EVERYTHING your neighbors are talking about/doing. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off at Nice Victorian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bertybign
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked a four day stay with my wife as the hotel is next to Grant Park on the lake front and fairly central to the Magnificant Mile and a range of museums etc. The hotel is of a Victorian style with large, bay windows and very high ceilings giving a feeling of spaciousness. The interior is a bit tired and dated with the corridors being dark and dull. Check-in was very fast (ess than a minute)and when I was shown to my "Lake View" room on level 6 I found that there was no sight of the lake because the trees of Grant Park completely occluded the view. The hotel would not change me to a higher level even though I had paid a big premium for the Lake view. Wired Internet was available in the room at $10 per day but was dissapointingly slow. To get wireless connectivity (vailable only in the foyer) required an additional payment of $7 per device - what a rip off! The room was comfortable with a massive bed and the Michigan Avenue outside was not too noisy to sleep. Breakfast was a disaster with a fairly good buffet available only on days when there was a high occupancy. I was required to buy pre-paid breakfast vouchers for $16 per day to use the buffet but on the days when this was not available I was forced to use the voucher for an "All American Breakfast" which was just two eggs, Toast, Hash Brownes and bacon. My wife being a vegetarian requested a salad bowl and toast but was told that the American Breakfast was all that was available despite there being a wide choice of vegtarian alternatives on the menu for less than $16. An argument ensued and the hotel maintained their stance that the prepaid breakfast vouchers eliminated all choice of other types of food. I ended up eating breakfast at a nearby restaurant and still paying for the vouchers at the hotel. Overall this could have been a nice hotel reasonably priced in a good location had it not have been for the strange policy on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Roxane M
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at the congress plaza hotel! The staff was wonderful, especially Deborah, she showed us the Gold room and told us some great history about this hotel. We stayed in a lakefront king room on the 14th floor. The View was spectacular. We even enjoyed the fireworks from our hotel room Saturday night. I can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was. This hotel is centrally located and has a great price. you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you're visiting Chicago. The building is gourgeous and it has a nice feeling. Staff are vey kind and Mr Siddiqui, the General Manager was paticularly diligent in getting what I was looking for. The pricing is reasonable, it is very well located. We were given a double room at the 14th floor with a spectacular view of the lake. I've read awfull reviews about this place, but I found it lovely. Give it a try and make sure you personally and nicely ask for an ample room with a nice view of the lake. If you ask for a room on the 14th floor with a view of the lake you won't be dissapointed. I promise.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: charlie c
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs! Bed bugs! Bed bugs! Bed bugs! Bed bugs! We didn't actually stay at this hotel because when we pulled the sheets back there were bed bugs aaaaalll over the place. We turned right around and told the front desk about it and were told "we don't have bed bugs." They were good about giving the refund which was nice. The room was really worn down. Everything smelled like lysol and the base board was unpainted wood. Aesthetic matters. Also probably haunted. Will not stay in the future

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great view”
Reviews.Author: bookedtogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Congress Hotel August 19 - 22nd - had a lakeview room. It's the perfect place to stay when visiting Chicago - three blocks from the train station, close to the parks, State Street shopping, the Shadd Museum and so much more. Our room was clean and perfectly kept. Was it an older building - absolutely. We found it fit our needs perfectly - not a problem at all. Love the Gold room - love the history. The price was fantastic also.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Ignore the bad (and fake) reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Kennedy95
Reviews.Content: Hm where to start? First off, please ignore the bad reviews, they are either fake or for a different place! We arrived at the hotel, no picketers (didn't see them untill the third day and it was only a couple of people walking around with signs, no trouble at all, it's been going on for 8 years) Beautiful lobby, check in was a breeze and all the staff were pleasant. Got to the room (via some very posh elevators!) to find a huge room with two queen beds, walk in closet, writing desk, flat screen tv, large chest of drawers, table with 2 chairs, coffee maker, a standing lamp and two matching table lamps too. Everything was spotless, including the sheets, towels and bathroom. Coffee maker and TV worked fine along with everything else. We didn't have a lakeview room but could see over the park and the field museum so it was okay. The wallpaper, shower curtain, bed sheets and towels all proudly bared the hotel emblem on them which was a nice touch. The beds were comfortable and clean. We were on the seventh floor and it didn't take any time at all for the water to get hot, yes, the bath did drain a bit slow, but you have to remember the pipes are old and it isn't really a problem! All the staff we came across were friendly and helpful. The food wasn't all that great but if you're on holiday you don't just eat in the hotel! The staff were extremely helpful when we had to extend our stay a few nights and it was no problem, thanks to Margarita, the front office manager for being very helpful with this :) When we did leave the bellhop got us a cab to the airport no troubles at all. This hotel has charm but is still up to modern standards and worth a lot more than 2 and a half stars, more like 4! A couple of spooky things occured (saw figures in the corridor and the tv remote got moved a couple of times) but I enjoy that sort of things so it was okay, the corridors are quite creepy but not too bad. The hotel smelt fresh and nice throughout, would love to know which air freshner they use! Yes the air con only blows cold in the summer and warm in the winter, but you can turn it off so it isn't a problem, plus it was hot when we were there but the lobby and room was always cool. If I'm ever in Chicago again Iwill be staying at the Congress, amazing location too! So please ignore the bad reviews and give it a go, you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Value and location a plus otherwise not great. Would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: purpletreegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with friends and my daughter. We saw a dance benefit across the street so the location was perfect for that. We were looking for value and a lower cost point so know that can come with some limitations. The room was quite tired and smelled of smoke. Bed and pillows were not comfortable. Why do hotels not use fitted sheets on their mattresses? Basically slept on a ball of sheets and heard the L all night. Check in was probably the worse service. Had to wait in a long line. Not a smile or friendly face to greet us. Rooms not ready. Checked us in but had to wait in line again later to just pick up the key. Frustrating. The Bell service seemed to have things under control so that was nice. I would not stay at this hotel again unless I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Historic But Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: lindalara53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Congress hotel during "Taste of Chicago" the location was perfect and the hotel has that old historic charm but the staff is less than friendly and the cleanliness leaves something to be desired. We will be staying somewhere else for our next weekend get away downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tylerb83
Reviews.Content: Look, I'll say this for all of my reviews regarding hotels having low prices: If you're coming to Chicago to stay in a posh luxury hotel, don't stay here. If you're coming to Chicago to be in the middle of it all and pay an amazingly affordable price, then do stay here. Was the room perfect? No. But what is? It was, however, comfortable, clean and quiet. All we needed for a sound night's rest. When you wake up, head to Buckingham Fountain, the L, the waterfront, or any number of museums, stores, cafes or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Never use the parking facility !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jason y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the congress plaza for 3 days in Aug 2011. We are from Toronto and we drove and parked at the Park One garage at the back of the hotel. The hotel is providing valet service through this Park One company. When I left my car with them, the attendant drove off my car with hand brake still on. He was on the phone and drove with one hand. An ear piercing sound from the friction of the handbrake and the tires were so loud, but the attendant (whom was on the phone) could not care less. I made a complaint to the manager, and he asked him to drive my car down from the garage. The attendant was upset with my complaint, and he purposely hit my car against the corner while he drove my car down. He then handed over my car key to his manager and took off without a word of sorry. The manager (whom is just as useless) told me that he could not do anything as they are unionized. He was afraid that he might be sued by the attendant for sacking him. The best thing is, they have video camera to show that he was on a phone while driving my car, and they could probably see how he damage my car on purpose. This is a very typical example of "Get away with Murder" because of union protection. So for those who want to park at the hotel/Park One garage, you must be prepared to take the risk. If you complaint, you will get your car smashed up and they can get away with it. No one can touch the attendant. If there is a way to write to the CEO, I would. This is why they pay high insurance fees, and transfer to cost to their customers. I hope that no one should experience similar situation as I do in the future. If possible, stay away from Park One.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Gloria H
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a wedding. Our stay at the hotel could have been better if not for cockroaches. After the wedding I contacted the site I booked the hotel with. They obtained a 25% discount on the room we stayed. (I had booked two rooms for myself and my husband and my eldest daughter). I felt a "discount" was inappropriate, not to mention that the manager at the hotel was extremely rude to me when I asked why they didn't clean up the roaches we had killed after we rang them. Sadly, I was aware there were picketers outside the hotel and didnâ€™t think to visit their website. I wish I had now. This hotel shames Chicago! And if anyone has any type of health and safety or moral conscience you WILL NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better!”
Reviews.Author: CREA_tive07
Reviews.Content: The entrance and lobby were quite impressive, and staff was professional. Wonderful location which allowed us to visit Chicago as long as we wanted. Valet parking was expensive but worth it considering that it is hard to find a place to park in downtown Chicago. The rooms (regular I think) were decent but looked very very old. Wallpaper was starting to fall apart and the corners of the room were not very clean. It was nice to have adjoining rooms. Decent hotel but would only go there once. You're basically paying for the location....but you can find better rooms at that price in downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “No, no and no”
Reviews.Author: MarkoDani
Reviews.Content: The saying â€œYou get what you pay forâ€� is not true at all in this situation. We took deluxe suite with lakeview. First, we could hardly see the lake because we were on fourth floor which was way too low. Park view was fine. The room itself is outdated on so many levels. Jacuzzi looks more like a tub. Overnight, we could hear people laughing from the room next to us which was very annoying. AC had no temperature control. Only ON or OFF option. The only good thing I can say about our experience is that the bed was comfortable and the location of the hotels was great. For the $400 price, I donâ€™t think this was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay In Historic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Shar2312
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel last weekend. The location gave us prime access to all of the wonderful attractions that the city of Chicago has to offer. This is an older hotel with rich history and architectural charm. We found the staff to be courteous and efficient. We even had access to our rooms before the official check-in time. Given the location of this hotel, we felt that the price was truly a value! Our room was facing the "L" side. My 83 year old train buff dad was ecstatic! Others may prefer Michigan Ave view. Clean rooms, comfortable beds...what more could a guest ask for! We will definetly stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel again and recommend it to our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: eldiablo50
Reviews.Content: The exterior and lobby area of the hotel had everything you want when in historic Chicago. Plus the location is good - right along the Lake and makes center city easy to walk to. But if you plan on spending any time in your room either sleeping, bathing working then forget about it. My room was dirty - towles were shoved in the air conditioning unit to keep it quiet plus it didn't even cool the room, the rugs looked like they were used at a frat party and the paint job in the room looked like it was done by Stevie Wonder. The furniture looked like it was stolen from the set of a porn movie. All-in-all a terrible stay. Factor in that I had security following me around the lobby and souvenir shop like I was some kind of shoplifter just made things worse. Stay away from this hotel - based on what I saw - there has got to be hotels that are so much better for the price - it ain't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again”
Reviews.Author: jphuf
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay here, the other time was last year. The first time we were given a suite and this time a two bedroom suite. This is an older elegant style hotel but very well kept and renovated frequently. Fully staffed at all times. The rooms are very clean. Service is excellent & immediate. The toilet got stopped-up at 1AM, we called the desk & the plumber was there in 5-mins, fixed it immediately. The beds were very nice & comfortable with great room service. We ate dinner in their restaurant with no complaints about the food & service. The hotel is in a terrific location, across from Millennium & Grant Parks, the Buckingham Fountain, as well as the Downtown Loop is next door. The lake yacht harbors, Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum are all an easy walk. Michigan Av buses stop in front that go to the Zoo, Museum of Science & Industry as well as other places. We will stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Beautiful Old Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KatherineNoel
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a $28/night self park ramp behind hotel that was really easy to get to. We were able to have our bikes put in storage at the hotel-easy. The staff was very helpful. Check in and out was a breeze and the lobby is beautiful! We ate at ? can't remember the name but it was in the hotel and the food was delicious-waiter was great! The kids loved the grilled cheese sandwich and the portions were huge. Our room was a nice 2 bedroom/1 bath. 2 queens in 1 room and 1 king in the other. It was clean but you can definately tell it's age. Wallpaper was peeling in a few spots and I wouldn't want to stay here too long-I'd be worried about the kids getting lead poisoning from the paint (it looked 100 years old and you could tell the trim and doors had been painted over many a time-over chipped paint too-so it was lumpy) Doorknobs were cool but mismatched. I have restored 100+ yr old houses and know how to do it well, so I'm picky when I see someone trying to fix old things. The location is awesome! We biked to the Pier and beaches-the bike trail was very accesible from the hotel. We may stay here again when we are in the downtown area...maybe a more expensive room would be a little more polished? We paid about $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “we'll b back”
Reviews.Author: roccckky
Reviews.Content: we feel most of the bad reviews are not accurate... we wer apprehensive after reading many bad reviews... we were booked for 3 nights for a queens bed but was upgraded to a kings bed upon arrival .. ter is nothin to complain about the room tho it was not that fancy .. the AC worked very WELL(this was our biggest fear)...the bed was comfortable .. the bathroom was refurbished.. flat screen tv worked just fine and we watched 2 new movies....(10 per movie)... internet was very fast but no wireless.. the hotel itself was very quite and most of the time we felt away from humanity which we liked after gettin off frm a very very busy city :) .. i wud recmd it to my frnds and we will be back soon ,, and yes the 2nd day the room was not made up after we asked cleaners to come back after some time..

Reviews.Title: “A Congress you can trust.”
Reviews.Author: Seacombe
Reviews.Content: I booked this one on price despite having read some dodgy reviews so I went with my eyes wide open. It's often good to go with low expectations because hopefully they will be exceeded. They were. It was fine for us. Very handily placed for the city and a clean, comfortable family room with a well maintained bathroom and flat screen TVs (not a deal breaker but plenty more expensive places on our trip didn't have them). It's an old hotel but I personally rather like the charm of such places. The desk staff weren't particularly friendly or overly anxious to help but the bell staff made up for them. You could pay a lot more for a plusher place but I was in Chicago for just two days and wanted to see the city rather than the hotel. I'd recommend it for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: NEW71
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the Congress hotel is lovely and makes one think that even though it's an older place, it might still be inviting for a night or two. The location is fine, especially in the summer when Grant Park has much to offer. It is close to the Art Institute, Mag Mile, River North and most areas. The rooms of the hotel have not been updated since the 40's. The beds are new, fine but not comfy. Paint and wallpaper peeling off the walls. I was in a pinch and this was ALL that was available in Chicago. It is my goal to never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, ambiance and views.”
Reviews.Author: mufjul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on the following days: August 20 - 22 2009 and August 24 2009. We reserved the rooms on http://priceline.com and paid $129 for lake view rooms on Aug 20 -22 and $99 non-lake view rooms on Aug 24. The lake view rooms had gorgeous view of the Buckingham fountain. Their age does show though, but it's charming. The lobby was gorgeous and the employees were extremely friendly. The first night there, there were very loud hotel guests who came in around 4a.m., however they quietened down immediately after we placed a call to the front desk. The non-lake view rooms has a view of the lobby roof and they were very small with no bath tubs (they had standup showers.) As noted on other reviews, there were picketers outside the front entrance, (very depressing) but didn't really take anything away from our visit. The location was awesome, and the bellhops were extremely knowledgeable. Parking was $28 with unlimited in and out. Overall, I'd say this was a descent hotel for the price we paid for the accommodation. Keep your expectations decent and you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Please reconsider staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMMChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: First, I want to start off by saying that the staff was great but that is about it. I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights and when we arrived I was excited since it was an older hotel and I have stayed and many older hotels in Chicago and was always satisfied but this hotel is showing its age and the management doesnâ€™t seem to be doing anything to make it better. First there is a strange/musty? odor to the hotel and it lingers in the hallways all the way into the rooms. The rooms appear to be clean but the odor can make you think otherwise. The room itself has scratched/peeled furniture, the bed is something out of the Stone Age, the bathroom had cracks and holes everywhere, and the carpet just looks wet and musty. Also, the bathroom was horrible, besides the cracks and holes, first it took 2 hands to flush the toilet, it took 15 minutes for the shower to go from ice cold water to lukewarm water and then the tub would not drain! It was over half full by the time I got out of my shower and it didnâ€™t drain for 30 minutes and the only reason why it drained was because my husband had to mess with the drain. I did tell the front desk about it and they did seem to want to help but it was figured out by the time they got there. They forgot to clean the 2nd room I had booked for family and forgot to give us towels when they cleaned. Many say that this place has character and is beautiful and maybe the suites there donâ€™t have the odor or the cracks that my room had and I believe it would have more character if management kept up the building. Also, if you want to grab dessert do not go to the restaurant at the hotel. We ordered coffee and pie and when we got it, the coffee was cold and the pie looked like it was dropped on the plate and the waiter said â€œthatâ€™s how we serve itâ€�. I am not a restaurant critic and I donâ€™t consider myself a â€œfoodieâ€� but I have had many meals and desserts at hotels across the country, some 2 star â€“ 5 star hotels, and this was just horrible. I did talk to the front desk about all the issues I was experiencing along with the other guest I came with in the 2nd room and all she could tell me was â€œthere is nothing we can do since you pre-paidâ€�. She then goes on to say that she can check to see if there is another room available, but wasnâ€™t sure since they were sold out, and if there were other rooms available they would not be next to each other. I thought when you book two rooms; they are to be next to each other or as close as possible. The woman, manager, at the front desk wasnâ€™t rude but it just seemed like she had heard these stories before and didnâ€™t care. Also, which I did not see this when I booked online through hotels.com, there are workers picketing the hotel. I donâ€™t know the story and they were not violent or yelling anything to those walking in and out of the hotels but it was uncomfortable. According to a valet driver they have been on strike for 8 years and do this every day. All I can say is whoever owns this hotel should either put some real money into and renovate or just sell it to someone that would care for the hotel. I wouldnâ€™t even stay at the hotel again, even if it was for free. For any future visitors GOOD LUCK and I hope you have a better experience but just please consider paying a little extra and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Retro-cool in Chicago touristland”
Reviews.Author: kc88_10
Reviews.Content: After reading a fair share of negative reviews on this and other websites, my spouse and I were wary of our long weekend at the Plaza. But we were pleasantly surprised by the efficiency of checking in and out, the spaciousness and cleanliness of the room, and especially the friendliness of the concierge and porter staff despite being constantly bombarded by guests. The a/c worked, ice was always available, the bed was comfy, the room was cleaned, we barely heard our neighbors ... and I can't say the same about many other less-centralized places I've stayed for more money. The only downers? Having to pay seven bucks for 15 minutes of internet access (no thanks) and being told the wrong bus to the Adler Planetarium (NOT bus 10!). But that's minor, especially given their fabulous location ... c'mon, two blocks from Buddy Guy's Legends and the Art Institute? I loved the faded glory vibe, but unfortunately no ghosties hung out with us.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: jlondon7
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights July 19 - 21, 2011 with my sister. Room was $119/night (prepaid - 3 night stay). Bathroom had been updated. Safety deposit box. Closet big enough to read in while my sister slept. The a/c worked which was fantastic due to 3 days of 100 degrees F. The room did have a mildewy smell. Used our CTA bus pass - 3 days $14 - available at Union Station or some Walgreen's. We took the train from Port Huron to Chicago. Amtrak $64 return. Didn't need a car for our sightseeing. As the previous reviewers have stated, great location. Bakery Cafe had nutritious meals for $8. Saw the Blues Brothers musical at the Auditorium Theatre (directly beside hotel). Bus drivers were fantastic. Never waited more than 5 min for a bus. Buses were air conditioned. This was my 2nd stay at Congress. It is 2.5 stars. It does have history. Pay phones available at NavyPier and Chicago Cultural Centre (Tiffany domed ceiling & fantastic architectural features) Water Tower tourist info excellent. At same site, free internet at library site, reference books on Chicago, table for lunch, toilets and a cafe. Didn't pay a huge price for the room. We bought milk & orange juice at the 7 Eleven and put on ice each evening. Used the coffee maker for hot water for oatmeal in the morning. Enjoyed our stay in the "windy" city.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: reginacooper
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the negative reviews are correct. I also wanted to give this unique property an opportunity, but the lack of service is mind blowing. We called and confirmed the reservations the day before and asked to have connecting rooms. I was told that he could not do that, I had to request at check-in and it was a first come first serve. So I insisted if he could at least make an annotation on the reservation, because we had younger children. When I reached the hotel at 4pm, the front desk informed me the agent had not done anything. The front desk agent was very accommodating, and even though we waited, we did not mind. They were not connecting, but they were close to each other. The valet informed me that because I had a SUV the charge was $39.00, though I was quoted $28 for self parking and $33.00 for valet. The hotel staff will not quote you this price, but we be aware they you will pay more for certain types of cars. The rooms I must say were lacking, carpet was poorly installed and we found a dirty wash cloth. We did not complain, we were just happy to finally be in the room before 6pm. When we called in the morning to have someone pick up our luggage and pull our car around, we found out we had to physically go down to the valet and request our car be pulled around. The bellman could not do that. Talk about inconvenient, the guest has to do everything, there is no facilitation whatsoever and customer service is not even to be spoken about. So a second retrieved the car, and the third one loaded the car (I am not kidding). In the midst of this confusing process, our computer bag did not make it from the cart to the car. We were only traveling to Indiana and though we found out they noticed the bag , looked inside the bag, no one ever made any attempt to contact us , though they had all phone number , so we could retrieve it. We tipped well and everyone is this lengthy process. When we called after unloading the car, we called the hotel where they had the bag, but had the audacity to tell us we had to pay for it to be shipped. Talk about adding insult to injury. I am all about giving someone a second chance, but no one either the front office manager Margarita to the unreachable Director of Security Ruiz is willing to solve the problem, I can barely get them to contact me, even though Iâ€™ve explained the sense of emergency needed, because of what is in the computer bag. Even the GM according to the front desk agent was unwilling to speak to me; I needed to speak to the Director. So Iâ€™ve been waiting for a return phone call for over an hour , and have called the hotel 5 times , no one has returned my phone call, neither can they page of get a hold of the Director. Did I mention that they were going to leave a message for the director and that I informed them that it would be nice if she called us, I was told that I would have to call in.

Reviews.Title: “Where do all the nasty reviews come from?”
Reviews.Author: billinwilliamston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Congress Plaza Hotel July 15 - 17 2011. I had read all the negative reviews, but we chose to stay there anyway. Why?, It was at least $100 a night cheaper than any other downtown hotel and less than 1/2 the price of most. After staying there, I have to wonder how many of the negative reviews are from people who actually stayed at the hotel and how many are related to the on-going picketing. We got to the hotel at about 2:45 on a Friday afternoon. Check in was fast, friendly and efficient. There were no pickets when we arrived. The room was clean, well organized, nicely decorated and had a great view of Grant Park. The flat screen TV was a plus. The bathroom was clean and the shower had an unending supply of hot water and more than sufficient water pressure (no lo-flow shower head here). The king sized bed was comfortable. The air conditioning was more that sufficient for the high 80's to low 90's heat that weekend. Did I mention that it was $100 a night cheaper than any other downtown hotel? The number of pickets out front ranged between none and, maybe, 10 at most. Most of the time there were two or three people sitting on a bench next to their signs. I understand that this "strike" has been going on for over 8 years. Checkout was even faster than the check-in. Every employee we dealt with from the front desk to housekeeping to the bell staff was friendly and extremely helpful. We visit Chicago regularly and the Congress Plaza is definitely the best deal in town. The only negative was the picketers. If they could settle the strike and still keep their rates anywhere near what they are now, this would definitely be the best hotel for the money in Chicago. If you don't mind pickets, it's the best deal in town as is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Serg095
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located right on the S. Michigan St. within walking distance towards Millenium Park, Grant Park, Shedd's Aquarium, Field Museum. Legends music club is just two blocks gfrom it. But location is the only positive thing about this hotel. Rooms are old even they are refurbished. Towels were of poor quality and smelled. Don't know what detergent they use... Lived in the Family room however there were only two hooks in the bathroom to place eight towels :-( Sink was cracked. Extremely low pressure of hot water. Could not even imagine that it can be so low hot water in the downtown of Chicago in 2011. Will not recommend until there is no other options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location...”
Reviews.Author: EnglishTeechur
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of these reviews before we went to Chicago, and they only succeeded in making me nervous about what we were getting into. I was traveling with my family - which includes a six and a nine year old, and all the negative reviews gave me some concern...however, once we arrived nearly all of those concerns went out the window. People have to keep in mind that this hotel is over 100 years old...is it a bit run down? Sure. But it was clean and the location is perfect for a downtown visit. We walked nearly everywhere on our brief visit to Chicago.,.the museum campus is close, and we walked to the Shedd aquarium and Field museum (by the way you MUST take advantage of buying tickets online for the Shedd - we walked right past the line that others waited over two hours in), we walked to Millennium Park, the Magnificent Mile shopping, and even Navy Pier (a little too far for the kids - but a ten dollar cab ride back). Buddy Guy's Legends is less than two blocks away and a must visit for blues fans (I saw Buddy himself perform there the night I went). Bottom line is you are paying for the fantastic location in downtown Chicago. Be aware that the building is old and temper your expectations...we only stayed in the hotel to sleep anyway. The staff was helpful and cheerful, and our only issue was that our coffee pot in our room clogged up, which was easily fixed. Remember that most people who take the time to write a review are probably upset and venting a complaint...ignore the nitpickers and the ridiculous ghost stories and stay here for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is underrated.”
Reviews.Author: mother79
Reviews.Content: We read a variety of reviews before we decided to stay at The Congress. Once we arrived, we were so glad we chose this hotel in spite of some negative reviews. We were on the 9th Floor with a magnificent view of Lake Michigan and overlooking Grant Park. We were able to view the fireworks that were exploding over Navy Pier from our window. Anyone who appreciates architecture would love this old but elegant historic building overlooking Grant Park and facing the Buckingham fountain. We would go back to this quaint and ideally situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Hamster_Huey_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with family. What's great about it is location. That's basically it. Given the price, this place disappoints in every other way. We got a deal through expedia for a single night, boy do these people know how to have hidden costs. Parking is $28-35 per night. Internet is $7.75 for 15 minutes. Even local calls cost money. Breakfast was not included. Basically if you breathe, you pay money. The foyer area downstairs is gorgeous -- everything else is old, and to be honest quite creepy. I can honestly say I felt more comfortable at a $70 motel out of town than here in terms of atmosphere. The apartments themselves are old, the bedding was comfy but like i said i felt very creepy in the room and hallways, the stairs look original from back in the 1890s when the hotel was built. It literally felt like stepping on the Titanic or something before it sank, in some ways very interesting but as a place to stay overnight just creepy. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hallways need decore.”
Reviews.Author: luvwater
Reviews.Content: Congress Street is under construction and hard to get to - so take Michigan. There is also an OK place for a cheap breakfast & lunch on the Harrison side of the hotel somewhat attached to the Travelodge. Give yourself time to drop car and pick car up from valet - they are definitely in no hurry to help you on your way.

Reviews.Title: “Cautious due to reviews read on here ......”
Reviews.Author: llandeck
Reviews.Content: Like I said, I was cautious because of other reviews I had read. However, because this hotel allowed us to check in at 10 a.m. we went ahead and booked it. We arrived at the hotel at 10:05 a.m. and went to check in. They told us our room wasnt ready and they would refund us the amount we paid for the early check in. I very politely said that was the whole reason we booked there and we needed to check in right now so we could get on with the rest of our plans for the day. The front desk clerk said she would talk with the manager. About 2-3 minutes later they came out, apologized, and said they had a room. I thanked them and continued checking in. As we were finishing the paperwork, the clerk informed me she had upgraded us to a Jr. Suite due to the hassle. We went up to the 6th floor and entered our NW corner room. Upon entering, we saw a very nice suite with two bedrooms, a bathroom, and a living room area. Yes, the hotel is very old and in some places shows it's age, however it is a very classy, old hotel. As my wife said, "it added some character to the hotel." We enjoyed our stay completely. Receiving the upgrade was an extra plus. In regards to the strike and the haunting, we almost always entered the building off of Congress Parkway and never saw picketers there. The one time we did enter from Michigan Ave., we saw about five picketers, but had no problems walking around them. As far as haunting, dont know if this has anything to do with that, but at around 1 in the morning, there were 2 VERY loud, forceful knocks either on the wall or the front door. It happened just the one time and we fell asleep. It could have been someone that knocked and then realized they had the wrong room or who knows what it could have been. I can not say. We would once again take a chance and stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Failed on All Levels”
Reviews.Author: MKB1701
Reviews.Content: Came here for the last leg of our trip to Chicago and Milwaukee, and boy, did this place disappoint. When you walk in, you are greeted by an absolutely gorgeous foyer and reception area, and you can easily see that this was once a grand luxury hotel. For us, this quickly faded when we were shown to our room. Upon entering the bathroom, there was filth on top of the toilet, which came from a leak from the room above. While we tried to turn on the TV to await a visit from hotel maintenance, it wouldn't go on. When I called the front desk once again to tell them about this, they told me it would be a while for someone to get up there, to which I responded, "Well, do you have another room that isn't filthy and in which the TV works?" That elicited quite the chuckle as if these problems were amusing. Came back later that evening and asked the concierge if they could arrange for a cab to pick me up at 4 am as I had a 6 am flight. I was told that no, they couldn't do that, and go to the front desk for the number for a cab. I've never encountered such lazy service at a supposedly high-end hotel. After that exchange, I decided that I'd be wise to stay up and not rely on them for a wake-up call in case they decided that that would be too much. Instead, I decamped in the hotel bar, which was nice and well-appointed and seemed to be the only thing in this place that worked as it should.

Reviews.Title: “It's a free country”
Reviews.Author: oldhickory5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the 4th of July, and I'd definitely recommend it, unless you're really picky. Which it seems a lot of people are. Fair enough. It's a free country where everyone's entitled to their opinion. This is mine. I'm reminded of a point that I've heard Authur Fommer make: "When the lights are turned out, every hotel room looks the same." His reasoning was that you're in the room to sleep. He also encouraged the notion that the room should be a good value. is the Congress Plaza perfect? No. But did the imperfections affect the rest that I got or the fact that I could clean up each morning and be ready to enjoy myself. Big NO. I was in Chicago to really enjoy what Chicago had to offer, and enjoy Chicago I did. And the Congress Plaza played a part in that enjoyment because of it's location. That was perfect! I've stayed in very few places where I didn't have to adjust to something about the place that wasn't perfect. Those things never spoiled what I was in town for, to have a good time! For example, the Congress is a huge property. Hot water heaters aren't a few feet from your room like they are at your house. In such a large facility, hot water has to come from a ways away. OK, adjust. Let the cold water run for a few minutes and you'll get scalding water if you want it. The only thing that I might agree on with those people who gave 1's is that there's no excuse for the desk personnel to be anything but cheerful and accomodating. That doesn't cost anything, and it goes a long way to mitigating complaints and making people feel better about their experience. But those 1's are way out of line. At worst this place is a 2. Those people who gave 1's must not have stayed in a place that was a real 1. I actually would give the Congress a 3.5 if I could. That would include a 5 for location!! Is it OK to stay here? Absolutely! Unless you're picky. It's a free country. Enjoy Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaTrevino
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the hotels location. I purchased a room over the 4th of July holiday (2011). After exiting the elevator at my floor (which was missing the number two at the top of the door where all the numbers of the floor are located. So someone wrote in its place "Dos" (Spanish for two). I smelled a pungent odor and the smell did not get any better in my room. We figured it had to be mildew. At first glance the room appeared clean. However under the bed was a layer of dust and a few pieces of trash. I have allergies and could not figure out why I kept waking up coughing during the night. Now I understand why! During the morning hours a hotel employee barged into our room without knocking. She apologized a lot but it did not remedy the situation because she saw my roommate in her underwear. We were appalled! We were moved to a second room and received a free buffet breakfast. Do not eat the bacon. It was like chewing paper. We did not get to stay the night in our second room because the toilet broke. It was unusable. We were moved to a third room. While the view was great the room was not. The carpet had ripples in it from where it separated from the floor underneath and there was a six inch rip in the carpet as well. All within the walking path which presented a huge safety risk! After going out for a bit we arrived back at our hotel room only to discover that we could not enter because our keys would not work. I was so angry at the state of this hotel that I along with my roommate tried to discourage a potential buyer, inquiring about hotel prices, from staying there. We were so relieved and happy to leave the hotel. The manager â€œcomptâ€� me one night. I feel I should have been given at least two nights. As we rode down the elevator we noticed that the number plaques were removed. Be careful exiting the building. Do not run into the hotel employees who are on strike! There is not enough money to get me to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ponza7
Reviews.Content: Went there for an all inclusive wedding ceremony and banquet and had a great time. The Gold Room was beautiful. Also, the Taste of Chicago was right across the street. The hotel was built in 1893. The bathroom was completely remodeled recently. The shower was excellent. Of course the woodwork and doors look old but the bed was very comfortable and everything was always clean. Excellent room service and food. The location was outstanding. Outside bar and dining on Michigan Ave. If you are going to sit in your room all day then you might prefer something fancier, otherwise I highly recommend staying there and plan to again. My only complaints were that the air conditioning wasn't very cold but you could still open the window and get the Lake Michigan breezes. The other complaint was that we didn't see any ghosts. I think the room prices for downtown Chicago were very reasonable. The taxes are additional. The photo was taken from our lake view king room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: shyanncherub
Reviews.Content: We booked for the 4th of July, got there July 2 and our room smelled of mildew. The first night we had to call security because we could here the people next to us through the paper thin walls, a guy was cussing and fighting with his girlfriend, it sounded as if they were in our room. The bed was horrible, like sleeping on the floor and we were so sick with allergies. The second day a maid walked in on me changing clothes, without knocking or anything. They moved us to a "nicer" room. We were in that room for only an hour and the toiled broke and overflowed so they moved us to yet a 3rd room. The carpet in the 3rd room was ripped and coming up, causing tripping. We paid $165 for our "rooms", rooms that were terribly outdated (paint peeling, dirty, old worn out and uncomfortable furniture) ~ staff was not great at all. I would have been more comfortable sleeping in my car than in the old, smelly, broke down, outdated crap hole.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cc0021
Reviews.Content: I firmly believe that at some point in history, this was a beautiful luxury hotel. . . those days are long gone. My husband and I were in Chicago for a fun weekend Mid-June. We were unable to check in early (not even 10 minutes early), which was fine, but the front desk staff told us there was "NO WAY, we have tons of people leaving and they were very busy", and they were quite rude about it. The room we received, which was to be a park view, actually looked out into a wall of another part of the hotel. Okay, not the end of the world. Our bed was the most uncomfortable mattress ever. You could feel the springs on your back and I can't imagine the mattresses have been replaced in a VERY LONG time. They actually made the beds in Mexico seem comfortable . . . Our A/C was not working, we called twice and they finally sent someone up. Was not really able to do much, he did the best he could. They have some antiquated A/C system that just runs cold water through * blows cold air across the cold water pipes. WOW, thought it was 2011?? Our room was on the 6th floor with a hall door right next to ours, and another hall door 10-12 feet away. Every time someone went through the doors, they SLAMMED shut. I mean, seriously, they have had to have a multitude of complaints about this.. Ever heard of a door closer?? We tossed and turned the first night, door slamming repeatedly, and then in our adjoining room (guests not with us) through the paper thin door we spent half an hour listening to to 2 men talking amazingly loud at 12:30 a.m., cell phones ringing non stop. My husband finally couldn't take it any longer, we called the front desk and thankfully they sent up a bellman right away to move our room. The front desk person and the bellman were the only reason I rated the service a 2. I realize they have no control over who is in the room next to you, but the odds of it being a problem with the paper thin door is huge, we could here everything they said. I have never stayed in a hotel with such a poor experience, and we've stayed in many cities and many hotels of many different ratings. It is amazing to me the kind of money they charge, and they acted like they were doing us a favor, not like we were customers. Unfortunate experience for such a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Strike and Heckled”
Reviews.Author: Edger66
Reviews.Content: I was on a quick business trip to Chicago and planned on staying at the Congress Plaza Hotel for two quick nights. Upon arrival, there was a full-blown labor strike in progress with bull-horns and about 100+ people picketing. Apparently, these folks were not paid before they were fired... Only in Chicago! (I enjoyed the show, and took a picture the following morning for proof. Just for all of my TripAdvisor family! Enjoy) Aside from the check-in excitement, mostly all I can say is that the hotel is old and needs a serious update. I checked out after one night stay. I will spare you all of the adjectives and room descriptions, and just say that I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It's more convenient than anything else”
Reviews.Author: Blakey_MissT
Reviews.Content: A colleague recommended it as he had stayed there a couple of years' ago and was raving about the classic flare of the building. I was not impressed as to how outdated the rooms were! The bathroom still has flouroscent (sp!) lights with hardly any counter space for your toiletries (in fact just a glass shelf) and a pedestal sink. We paid $134, 152 and 170 for three nights which I think was not that well worth. The front desk staff was not polite. I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: notplnjane
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this hotel over the July 4 weekend because a family member selected it. The other members of our party are going home tomorrow and we are checking out and into a different hotel. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone under any circumstances. It is OLD -- and while old can sometimes mean charming, in this case it means run down. The rooms are the size of European hotels with mismatched furniture; the beds are not comfortable, and the bathroom is nasty. When I took a shower a 9:30 a.m., there was little hot water. We arrived yesterday about 2:00 p.m. and were told that our rooms would not be ready until 3:00 p.m. -- the same thing that the front desk was telling every guest. So we waited until 3:00 p.m. only to be told that our rooms were "not quite" finished but we could have the keys anyway. When we opened the door, we found an unmade bed, wet towels, full waste baskets, trash on the carpet, and the previous guest's tablet and travel guides. Nothing had been done to clean the room and yet it was given to us as being "almost ready." I wanted to use the exercise room but the air conditioning was turned off. When I inquired about turning it on, I learned that the controls are in the Security Office and it makes so much noise, that they leave it off. Of two treadmills, one had a sign that it was "out of order" and the other was stuck in the maximum incline position -- so no workout today! Yesterday, we had lunch in the adjoining restarant. The food was fine; however, the server failed to bring salad dressing for one of the salads and the children's chicken fingers were straight out of a frozen food bag. While these things may not be so bad; the price was that of a 4-star property. Do NOT stay at this hotel in spite of its convenient location. It should be shut down by the health and sanitation commission and never re-opened.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: justmeinsd
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Congress Plaza Hotel to attend a wedding. We had the extra benefit of having Taste of Chicago right out the front door. This made the hotel an excellent location for us. If I was going to spend time just having fun and NOT going the museums, I would pick a location on the other side of the river. As for the rooms, they are old but they were clean. The bed was comfortable and the linen was nice. Better than the scratchy stuff I have had at other better hotels. We stayed in Room 1036 which meant we had an interior view. Since we only paid $129 a night for it we were not expecting a river view. The bathrooms do need updating and there was little space for girl type of stuff. The housekeeping staff did their job. We didn't have anything wrong so unable to comment on speed of maintenance service. We got there early and asked if we could check in. The front staff was short with us. The nut of it was you can check in after 10 am for an extra $49 plus taxes. We gave the bellmen our bags and took off sight seeing. When we returned a little after noon, there was new people of the front desk that where nicer. Got our room without any problem. The wait staff in the outdoor bar area went out of their way for us. The bar was closed but we didn't want to sit outside. They found away of getting the bar open for us. 5 stars for that part of our experience. We didn't eat there except for the wedding banquet. I was surprised at how tasty the food was. Everyone was talking about how good the Italian Wedding soup was and I agreed with them. This isn't the Four Seasons nor are you paying their rates. All but one person had great interpersonal skills. So if it fits your needs, don't be afraid of staying there. If you require a high level of lodging, don't. I would not suggest you stay here if you are looking for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS RAT TRAP !”
Reviews.Author: JCL20
Reviews.Content: This classic hotel is horribly neglected; staff have been on strike since 2003 - longest labour dispute in US history yet no warnings on hotel website - picket lines every day - disgraceful wages and employee conditions; low functioning air conditioner just recycles stale, humid air resulting in very damp room; air conditioner vent clogged with dirt; entire hotel needs maintenance before this historic gem is lost - neglectful owners; avoid the "Gazebo" restaurant - grossly over priced and worst breakfast I've ever eaten; noise; low pressure in faucets; no WiFi in rooms; no outside phone lines; uncomfortable beds; dirty carpets; needs a major overhaul with a heritage architect; will never stay at this hell hole again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Congress Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikuropka
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel. It was within walking distance to many restaurants. It was very close to Grant and Millennium Park as well as the magnificent mile. It was only a 5 minute taxi ride to all the bars. The location was the best. Also, the hotel staff were very knowledgeable and were able to give his tips on where to find the hidden gems of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal on short notice, but we had no time to shop around”
Reviews.Author: coloradodreamininTX
Reviews.Content: Due to a series of ridiculous catastrophes, at the end of our wedding week we missed our train from Chicago back to Texas. Near broke, without our rental cars, and desperate (with three kids in tow), we used the last of our laptop battery charge to search for a reasonable place to stay that would be within waking distance to Union Station so we could catch a train the following day and avoid yet another taxi (we had so much luggage that even taxi vans had trouble carrying all our stuff!). Seeing as how this was literally last minute and we were downtown, we were afraid everything would be pricey. We lucked out and scored a room at the Congress Plaza for all five of us for under $100! We checked in within the hour. I must be honest and share that none of us have ever stayed in an older downtown hotel; we are used to Quality Inn and other budget chains. Never anywhere with a bellhop or room service even. So we were very impressed upon first glance of the lobby and building overall and the "fancy'" elevators and such. The overall effect, however, once we got to our room, was that of a little girl dressed up in a rich old lady's finery. The room had so much potential but aesthetically failed with weird mismatched tile, peeling paint, and just an overall weird decor that wasn't working. Whatever, I can deal with slightly ugly. Pros: the beds were comfortable, shower functioned well, bath tub was even deep enough for a soak. The flat screen functioned just fine and we ordered pizza for a reasonable price from the menus we found in the room (kids were not opposed to yet ANOTHER deep dish pizza!). The room was roomy enough with 2 beds, didn't feel cramped. The big CON for us was the room temp. It would not cool off. We thought maybe we were not understanding the AC system as the controls were weird, so we finally called someone to come up and check. We were assured it was indeed "on" and in the coolest position, but it never cooled off. This was in late March and it snowed the next day; temps were LOW, so I don't know why this room was so unreasonably warm but we were all uncomfortable. Being on a higher floor means no opening the windows either. And, being from Texas one thing we expect (demand) is ice cold AC so this was a major frustration. In the end we were too exhausted to care and we all managed to sleep. If we'd been staying for more than one night it would have been an issue though and we would have made more noise about it. Aside from that there was an issue of the bedside table lamp being broken. Someone came and retrieved it but never brought another. Again, too tired to care. Overall our stay was novel and not horrible considering the good rate we got on such short notice and so close to where we needed to be. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the EXCELLENT attention and service we received from the bellhop staff and supervisor. In the end we ended up not taking the train back to Texas due to a crazy fare increase, and we chose to rent a car instead. My spouse went to retrieve the car and was given a different size than we'd expected. Remember our huge ton of luggage? Well you guessed it, when we started packing up the rental we realized it wasn't all going to fit. The bellhop spent a good 20 minutes out there with us trying to make everything fit into this rental car and was good-natured about it to boot, even in freezing windy weather. We ended up having to unpack one of our suitcases, choosing one that had seen better days anyway, and he offered to toss it for us; that was the only way to get all our stuff into that car, but the good humor and "can do" attitude from certain staff members was something we won't soon forget. It helped make a very stressful situation a little less of a nightmare and was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: kgood208
Reviews.Content: CONS: Don't expect to be treated like a guest, more like a neighbor. Rooms are very small and not well maintained. AC did not work well and the AC in the room adjoining ours was very loud and noisy. Carpets were well worn in places from traffic and our room had a distinctive cigarette smell. I made the reservations a month in advance for a king bed in one room and two queens in an adjoining room. We did get two rooms next to each other but both had a single queen bed in each room. Our 18 year old son had to sleep with his father while I slept with our twenty year old daughter. Not at all what we had promised them. When we complained to the front desk we were told in no uncertain terms that this was what we would get no matter how much we argued. No continental breakfast was given to us and the restaurant never had guests in it (blessing in disguise?). When our rooms were cleaned the coffee pot was not restocked. There were no coupon books in the rooms or the lobby for area attractions and we had to figure out the local transit system on our own.The hotel staff was on strike and picketing in front of the Hotel. We were told it had free parking garage but had to pay $56 when we left two days later. I will never stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel again and would not in good conscience recommend this hotel to anyone. PROS: This hotel is in a great location to sightsee the city. Spend a little extra money and stay in a four star hotel. It will be money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverite4444
Reviews.Content: We could not find any other place to stay in Chicago, so we booked this hotel given its location. The rooms are dated, dark and smelly. The staff is very unprofessional; they could not find a package that had been dropped for me two days before my stay and I had to get back and ask numerous times to finally get it. They charged one of our rooms twice and we have left a number of messages to rectify the mistake, but it seems there's no will on behalf of the hotel to give us back our money. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, musky, and way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kelcor18
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed one night here and decided we won't be returning. Great location but not worth almost $200 a night.. The rooms are just disgusting. Aside from the gross red carpet and wallpaper, the overall cleanliness was pitafull. Our comforter was stained, along with our pillow cases, oh.. Not to mention long black hairs all over in our sheets. WARNING don't even think to look under the bed pad or bed itself, you'll gag. Our shower was filthy as well nor did it drain because the drain hole was clogged with nasty hair, I showered in flip flops by the way so I wouldn't have to step in the tub! It's noisy because of the Metra and the paper thin walls don't help the situation either. I dont care if this hotel is 540 years old, most of the issues we had, had nothing to do with age. It has to do with lack of care and neglect. I would of paid an extra $100 a night just to feel comfortable.. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “I DO NOT Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kris22222
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel was unpleasant from the moment I arrived. Staff is unprofessional and uninformatative. My hotel room was awful and when I asked to switch, my request was never processed and my room ended up being canceled, without my knowledge. After explaining all of this to the manager, she did not once apologize or offer any better ways to assist me - this is just one example of the poor level of service at this hotel. I am a frequent business traveler and have stayed at many wonderful hotels. I will never return to this hotel and I strongly recommend finding other lodging options.

Reviews.Title: “Charged me $250 extra for stain in carpet that was already there.”
Reviews.Author: sundroptim
Reviews.Content: Older outdated hotel with great location and decent rates...so I thought until I was charged $250 after my departure for a carpet damage that was already there. Having a very hard time getting resolution.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe we paid $200 to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Indyann
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel. The good -- great location right by the Buckingham Fountain, walking distance to the Museum Campus. Also, our room was huge. The beds were decent. I would have been perfectly satisfied if we had paid $100 for this room, but I can't believe we paid $200 for this room. It had old, dirty red carpet that was taped down in spots with black duct tape. I took a shower at 3 p.m. and didn't have hot water. The bathroom floor was done in vinyl floor tiles which were filthy at the seams. Our hairdryer was broken. I wouldn't have been upset about that, except the maintenance man didn't bring a new hairdryer when he responded to the call initially -- he just wanted to make sure it really wasn't working. Is there anyone who doesn't know how to work a hairdryer??? Plus, he wasn't in uniform -- just jeans and a flannel shirt, and I find that creepy. Hotel employees should always be in uniform. Final complaint: we booked a double room, and we were stocked with just 3 bath towels, one hand towel and one washcloth. A room that sleeps four people should come with four of each!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: willempostTheHague
Reviews.Content: Opposite the Buckingham Fountain (best point to make pictures of the Chicago skyline!). Near the loop, Millenium Park and 15 minutes walk to the Chicago River and the 'Magnificent Mile'. Huge hotel, very interesting history (Al Capone was the owner for a short period) and spacious rooms. Yes, it is a bit older but the room was clean. Our whole group of 13 people was happy with his hotel. Nice bar-area and antique lobby. Will not hesitate to come again. Architecture-boat trip highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great experience, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kstone522
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a large business conference, and I was a bit nervous about this hotel because of mixed reviews. Here's my honest experience: Upon arrival (around 2pm) there were no picketers, check-in went quickly and smoothly, with pleasant staff. Room was spacious and clean, and smelled great. We didn't have a great view, but I don't judge a room by the view. Bathroom was clean, large, nice big mirror with long glass shelf spanning almost the entire wall, nice pedestal sink. Regarding some claims about hot water: it did take a minute or so to warm up, but it really wasn't a big deal, and the water did get very hot, and shower had excellent water pressure. I did take one bath - tub is small but nice. The bed was comfortable. All linens (sheets, curtains, towels, shower curtain) were custom with the hotel's emblem. TV was flat panel, wall mounted, and worked well. There is no wireless internet in rooms, but I didn't even bring a computer, just used 3G on my phone, so it didn't bother me. If you want to use internet, there is a wire at the desk in the bedroom. Room was quiet, barely any outside noise, and no noise from other hotel guests. All staff encountered were pleasant and helpful. I ate in the restaurant, and the food was good. The only negative thing that I'd have to say is that the menu was more upscale (did have less expensive options such as sandwiches and burgers too) but the environment didn't match the menu - the kitchen was visible and I heard "order up" several times. Regardless, the food and waitstaff were great. I was not bothered by housekeeping (an issue I've experienced in other hotels, and I never allow housekeeping in my room until I check out because I had items stolen at a Courtyard Marriot once). Bottom line - the hotel is older, but has great charm. Room was nice and clean, not dilapidated as others have described. Staff was nice. I did see picketers twice, but they are in front, and once you're checked in, you can use a side entrances by scanning your room key card, and it's a non-issue. Proximity to points of interest, train stations, etc is excellent, and considering other hotel prices in the area, it was an excellent value. Very nice part of town - walked around quite late at night and always felt safe. I'd highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Picket lines and paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: iamstein
Reviews.Content: I had to cross a picket line every day to get to my hotel and the walls are paper thin, which meant I had to listen to a screaming baby before I went to sleep and when I woke up each morning. The hotel is in a good location and it's a reasonable price, but so it may still be worth it for you, but be prepared. There are reasons why it is so affordable.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tek1
Reviews.Content: great location on main street across from park, hotel is very old but that is part of the charm. room was fine, bathroom was very small and out-dated! comfy sleep, friendly staff. we never ate at the restaurants but it seemed busy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: adiatasha
Reviews.Content: Hi Friends I stayed for one night at the Congress Plaza Hotel the weekend of May the 21st, I will explain why we only stayed one night later. After reading all of the reviews I was soooo scared of staying at the Congress. I expected bugs, no a/c, a dirty bathroom, dirty bed...I expected yuckiness to the 10th power. Needless to say, I saw none of it. We had a lake view King on the 12th floor. The view was great! The room and bathroom were clean. The park was across the street. The floors were clean. Flat screen TV on the wall. The elevator doors look original. Looks like where the rat pack might have stayed. It is not modern There is no HD TV It does not have floor to ceiling windows. It is not swanky or posh The only reson we stayed on night was because of the picketers. My BF just couldn't do it. Crossing the picket line felt horrible. They have been picketing for 7 YEARS. If you google it you will see why. So, if you want a clean room, clean bed, clean bathroom, a TV, a view of the lake and park and don't mind crossing the picket line. Then stay here. But because of the picketers I just can not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mgalla4728
Reviews.Content: Because this was my first time in downtown Chicago, I did not really know why to expect. My wife was at a weekend class so I was on my own during the days to explore. Too bad it was raining, cold and windy the whole time. The hotel was hot and stuffy. There were picketers out front which bothered me because I usually don't cross picket lines. The worst thing was no wifi in rooms. Come on... Every Super 8 least has wifi. It was available in the lobby for an outrageous price. On the plus side, the bathrooms had been upgraded, and our room had a flat screen TV, but it definitely was not HD. Overall I thought the place was overpriced, but so was everything else in downtown Chicago. In the future I will avoid this whole town if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: lsteel
Reviews.Content: We had planned to visit Chicago with friends and they had booked 2 rooms at the Congress Plaza Hotel for a two night stay in Chicago from 25-27 April 2011. On reading the reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor, my husband and I were a little concerned. However, our stay in the hotel could not have been better. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had rooms in the North Tower (the original part of the hotel, I believe) and overlooked Congress Parkway but we could also see the park and lake from the side windows. We had booked rooms with a King Bed but in fact got two large rooms with two beds - which wasn't a problem. The rooms were large and extremely clean and had thick carpet. The beds were very comfortable and the linen was spotless. There is a large flat screen TV in the room. The hallways were also clean. This is an old historic hotel but it's location is ideal. We found it charming and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. The only negative point about our stay was that we were woken by workmen starting digging up the road at 6.30 a.m. but that wasn't the fault of the hotel. We did see a few of the pickets outside the front door but we always used the entrance on Congress Parkway where there weren't any and only used the front door once - the pickets didn't even glance at us, so there wasn't a problem. It was very cold and wet, so they have to be admired for sticking it out in such awful weather!! We only had one breakfast in the hotel on our last morning and that was fine, so can't comment on the other restaurants. The first night we were there, the barman was very attentiveand entertaining (Michael) but on the second night it was a different barman and he was more interested in watching the sport on the three TV screens in the bar than serving!! Fortunately for him it was a quiet evening!! If you only like modern hotels, then the Congress Plaza isn't the hotel for you. If you like hotels with a bit of character, then I can recommend it and if we get the chance to visit Chicago again, then I wouldn't hesitate in booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too hot, too small, too expensive, too bad!”
Reviews.Author: JohnJen69
Reviews.Content: Walked into wonderful customer service at the front desk. Thought it was going to be a wonderful weekend at the Congress. Had three night reservation and medicore expectations. Women at the front desk were thoughtful and kind. When we walked into our room we were overwhelmed by heat and a feeling of being completely uncomfortable. We immiediately called the front deak and asked how we could activate the air conditioning. We were told that turning on the air is not possible due to the fact that the building management didn't feel it neccessary to turn on the air. After a quick temperature reading of our room, we discovered the temperarure in our room was 95 degrees! We were told by the front desk to open our window the entire 3 inches it's "allowed" to open. We than went our for the night, only to come back to an over-heated, sticky, stuffy room. We asked immediately to check out next day and get the hell out of the hell the Congress Plaza so elegantly provided. We discovered on our way out, after 2 messly hours of sleep, many other travelers leaving hell. This confirmed my notion that perhaps we rented an actual room in hell. This was not supposed to be an issue, but the devil managing the Congress Plaza had yet another surprise for us. Our financial situation became obstructed by the mere fact that the Congress "Hot"el held over $400.00 hostage as restitution for our lovely stay at the devil's resort. The devil did not notify us of this new and interesting fee leaving us pondering, "did the devil take our debit card?" And the answer was "well, kinda". They take more money than your stay is worth and hold it for an undisclosed period of time. The mere fact that this hotel is old and charming leaves nothing for the hearts desire. It's terrible and no one should ever subject themselves to this poor service and treatment. This hotel has much to be desired and needs to take leads from places like the motel 6 and other dives that iould teach them a thing or ten.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrades but manageable.”
Reviews.Author: ayasg
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to explain that my range of "accetable" accomodations is quite wide and reviews are dependent on the purpose of the trip and the cost of the stay. I have backpacked when needed and I have also stayed at 5-star resorts. That said, I was still worried about the reviews here on TA about the hotel which had already been booked by a colleague. The famous picket line was there when we arrived and throughout our stay but they were just there and the only "hassle" would be having to walk around them to your cab. It's not at all like some strikes I know where people going in and out of the building are harassed. The staff at the front desk as well as the bellmen were very friendly and readily answered any of our questions. We did not get a lakeview room. I don't know if there are more modern rooms available but ours does not seem to have been renovated for several decades. Our room was right beside the stairway and elevator and so the "dark creepy halls" described in other reviews did not bother us too much. We had an extremely chilly first night. The heater was giving off air so we thought that maybe it was just cold. Come morning though, we requested help adjusting the heater. Assistance was very, very prompt but something must have been wrong (or maybe to do with age) with the heater because the engineer helped us out by giving as an additional portable heater which was enough to make the rest of our stay comfortable. We did not eat at the restaurant, deciding to try out Chicago's more famous eateries and restaurants instead. One great tip I got from a local I had met was to try out Mercat, a tapas place, a few meters down the road at the Blackstone hotel. A bit pricey but it was very good food and worth it. There are a lot of reasonably priced coffee shops and eateries in the area, likely because of students from the nearby colleges. Location was good because it is along Michigan Ave. and seemed to be in between McCormick Place/museums and the Magnificent Mile. The only other hotel I have stayed in in Chicago is the Westin Michigan Avenue. I have to confess that I did not pay for either of these hotel stays (this trip was for work and the other was a Christmas gift). Given the difference in price between these two hotels, then a stay at the Congress is quite manageable. This hotel must have been wonderful in its prime, you can still see signs of grandeur in the intricacy of the woodwork. It could be wonderful again but someone mentioned that the owner's children are all overseas and don't really personally bother with the hotel so it is highly unlikely that any major improvement can be expected in the future. If I had to personally pay for the hotel and if I was on a budget, I would definitely look at other places to stay but would not mind if I had to stay here again for business. It would not be a choice for a vacation with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asteelersfan
Reviews.Content: This was supose to be a anniversary to remember in a great way but instead it started off terrible. As my wife and I was showing up to the hotel we found out that you pay $24.00 a day/night for parking but thats not so bad if your wanting to please your spouse.
