What the problem with this stay was as my wife and I walked and placed our suitcases inside the over priced room that we were given my wife calmly said there is a bug over here by the bed which from living in the atlanta area this wasnt just any bug it was a very large cockroach live and healthy almost the size of a ink pen. I was so distraut by this that I notified the front desk of my findings and they sent a guy up to the room to disgard of this bug. When I asked for a refund they told me that I would have to wait for a review to be done before refund would be awarded so if your wanting your stay to be a night with the crawles than you'll enjoy your stay but for us we found a cheaper but more elegant Hampton hotel to stay at just 20 min up the road in Skokie.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry, It's a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kevkatbar
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was a little worried when I made my reservation for the weekend of March 12 and 13th. My family and I were dropping off my daughter at school, and thought it would be nice to see the Chicago St Patrickâ€™s day festivities over the weekend. Now when we usually travel we stay at places like the Best Western, Days Inn etc. so this was a treat. From when we pulled up and George the doorman met us, to going to our room which was huge with 3 double beds, to partying in the lounge down in the beautiful lobby, we had a great time. Friday night George the doorman, hooked us up at a nice bar and grill a few blocks away. On Saturday the hotel was in the perfect location to see the river turn green and make it back in time to catch the start of the parade. That night the lounge was our home base to play pool, darts, and listen to the jukebox all night long. Yes, the hotel is older and maybe not the swank hot spot, or have the glitz of a 5 star newer hotel. But if youâ€™re looking for a nice place to stay in the city The Congress Plaza Hotel will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for a older hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend of the St Patty's Day parade and celebration. This is an older hotel but still shows it's elegance and class. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Our room was a little dated with the furniture but clean and has luxury linens and a comfortable bed! The bathroom has lots of tile and marble. I think people have given this hotel a bad rap because of it's age. However if you can appreciate the elegance of a historic hotel you will find it charming and lovely. This isn't a trendy hotel and ultra modern chic. And it was packed for the weekend we were there. There was a great pub downstairs and a beautiful lobby. The price is great for downtown Chicago and the location is right on Michigan Ave and in walking distance to everything. I'd stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older hotel - Great Location - Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JNP-PassportsReady
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a surprise weekend trip to Chicago for my husband's birthday. I had found an offer for a great rate for the Congress Plaza and booked it based on their own website and another (Expedia?) site's reviews. After I had booked, I read the reviews for the Congress here on TripAdvisor and got a bit worried. When we arrived, all of my worries were gone immediately. I am not sure, but it seems that perhaps the other reviewers were looking to stay at an ultra modern-contemporary hotel and were not familiar with what a true classic (and yes, older) hotel is like, but we were very pleased! Lots of marble & crystal, etc. We were given a complimentary room upgrade to a lakeview room and even though it snowed lightly while we were there, the view could NOT have been more spectacular!! Nice staff (Joseph the Bellman is a GEM!!!) as well as everyone at the front desk. Room Service was on time, and delivered exactly as I had ordered! Small mixup with Housekeeping (they showed up early on Saturday morning and we asked them to come back - they did - at 5:00pm!! (WHAT??!?!) But otherwise no issues. As I said, it is an older hotel, and the room furnishings are old also, but if you look at the inlaid wood work that went into making all of the matching bed, dressers, etc you will know that it was all hand-made and expensive in it's time. Also note, that big old king-sized bed with premium linens was REALLY super comfortable!! Who cared what it looked like once you laid down on it!! : ) So, don't go to stay here if you want hip / modern / contemporary. Go here if you want to know what class used to be like (and still is)! We would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Scary History, The Congress Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palongi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a ton of intersting history, but is scary to stay in! I didn't see another guest the whole time I was there and the staff was scarce. The rooms were in their original condition and had little to offer. We wandered through the enormous hotel and saw some interesting things, but I would not stay there again. It is in an ideal location though.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: travellingflower38
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a conference located just down the street from the Congress Plaza. As other reviewers have noted, it's quite old. But you won't get a better deal for your money in downtown Chicago. As long as you don't mind the worn furnishings and decay of bygone extravagance, it's a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jason_M_83
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel was pleasant enough. The room was pretty clean, if a little old feeling. I do seem to recall the wallpaper (which was hideous and matched the curtains perfectly) was peeling in one place near the ceiling by the door. The location is fantastic, right on Michigan Avenue. We had a good view of the lake from the room and the hotel is a short walk from just about anywhere. Overall, given the option, I'd probably stay somewhere else next time. The Congress Plaza Hotel is just too outdated for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Locatation, Okay Amenities”
Reviews.Author: mtngirljen
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Grant Park, and less than a $10 cab ride to the train station or north side shopping and sightseeing. The building has unique and charming architectural features, amazing views, and old think walls that eliminate all building noise. It was great for our small groupâ€™s new year festivities but I canâ€™t deny that I like the extra amenities that smaller boutique hotels offer.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in a taxi cab with the meter running before you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BigSeaton
Reviews.Content: I've had better experiences in cheap motels. I traveled with two other guests and we had two hotel rooms in separate towers of the hotel. Over the span of 3 days we were moved to 6 different rooms. Some rooms had no cold water, doors would not lock and to top it off, in the final room, I had to take a cold shower and was pelted with black funk out of the shower head. This black stuff caused my skin to break out in a rash. I confronted the hotel manager about it and he only offered to move my room (for the 7th time.) I refused to stay another night and they would not refund any money. I told the hotel manager I was going to file a report with the Health Department and he said, "Go ahead...I don't care...they won't do anything." Oh by the way, when you've had enough of this hotel and you try booking another one online, you'll quickly find out there is no wireless internet and the wired internet is outrageously priced. Emergency lights were burnt out and there were bare wires exposed in the hallways. I only encountered one nice staff member during the entire stay and she was terrified of her bosses. If every hotel in Chicago is booked, go to the slums and sleep on the streets...you'll probably be in better hands.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Suspicious Staff”
Reviews.Author: tina60745
Reviews.Content: We like to use hotel stairs to get exercise and found ourselves fascinated by the architectural details of this historic building. Luckily, we had our cameras so we took some pictures. Soon we found ourselves accosted by a security guard whose strident and abrasive supervisor was instructing him by radio to haul us into the security office, where we were required to display for inspection our innocuous photos of tile decorations and patterned carpets. The supervisor explained her reason for concern (she thought we might be assisting the striking workers by documentingâ€¦? we have no idea), but she never apologized to us for our inconvenience. Neither did the front desk clerk when we checked out. We were perfectly innocent guests of the hotel offering harm to no one, and we were made to feel like criminals. It was extremely uncomfortable and nothing was done to relieve our distress once we had proved ourselves harmless. We can understand the need for vigilance by security, but a classy (or even a merely competent) operation would have offered their paying guests something to compensate for this kind of mental discomfort and inconvenience â€“ a complimentary drink in the hotel lounge or restaurant would have done it. But no, the indifferent staff of the Congress Plaza were apparently too focused on their animosity toward the striking workers to offer quality customer service to their guests. We will be sure never to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away unless you're desperate!”
Reviews.Author: debbie9191
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel for a business trip to Chicago. There was a special event in Chicago and all the hotels were either full or asking crazy nightly fees. I chose this hotel out of desperation and I paid a 4star hotel price. The location is ok, but that's the only good thing about this hotel. The hallways were creepy and it was a very long walk from elevators to my room, definitely not good for families. I became almost short of breath upon entrance to my room because of the air refreshener they used. They had probably sprayed the whole bottle to make it smell nice. The windows were stuck and it took tremendous effort to open them to get fresh air. I called the operator and they said it was the same air refreshener they use in each room, so smell would be the same. Plus, the hotel was full due to the event. Otherwise the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. But it was very noisy due to nearby train route. The next night, I used the toilet in the middle of the night and the flush got stuck. I didn't call anybody since it was 2 am and I didn't want anybody in my room at that hour. So I tried to take care of it myself. I also noticed there was no hot water late at night, it was warm only. The room was poorly decorated and everything was very old except the TV. The towels felt clean but they had a strong bleach smell. I will never ever stay at this hotel again and will cancel my trip if it's the only hotel available in the whole city. I am glad my husband couldn't come with me and the kids didn't have to stay at such a horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “considering the good price - o.k.”
Reviews.Author: carolinebg13
Reviews.Content: Considering the price I paid, I did not expected more. The bed was comfortable. The internet was supposed to be included in the price and was not. The location of the hotel is excellent. I red some pretty poor comments from other users and I found that some of them were over the top. If you have a short business trip with a restricted budget, I would recommand this hotel. I would definitely not recommand the hotel restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the negative reviews steer you away”
Reviews.Author: delkc
Reviews.Content: I too read the reviews, good and bad, about this hotel, and decided to go ahead and make the reservation. I'm glad I did! The location is ideal for the museums, Navy Pier, and the Art Institute. Public transportation is EASY to access from the hotel, just 1 or 2 blocks to either a bus stop or an L stop. The hotel is very old, but well kept up. Our room was large with tall ceilings, very large bathtub and shower, and I honestly slept better there than at home (very comfortable beds). There were a few picketers out front, but not every day. We stayed for a week, and I would definitely stay again. If you are looking for a very modern building with a sterile looking environment this is not the hotel for you. But if you want something with some character, you need to check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if everything else is full”
Reviews.Author: BNP0919
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal and I'm sure that's why so many people stay here. However, the hotel is a bit dated and it is time for a renovation. The bar staff was great and the dinner restaurant was attached was also a good staff. But the other staff has a lot to be desired, in particular the concierge. I was here for a conference at the convention center McCormick Place and I asked for the best way to get there. He said it was only a 10 minute walk and it ended up being an hour and a half. When I got to the conference, I found out that everyone was using the bus or the shuttle provided and nobody was walking. We reported this to the manager and she also thought it was a 10 minute walk and didn't seem to care about the bad advice. On our final day we bought tickets from a different concierge to go sightseeing and he actually hustled us, we thought we were getting a full days use but come to find out the tickets we purchased were only good for half a day. I would stay here only if nothing else was available and do not use any of the hotel services other than the nice bartenders and the french toast from room service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful exterior, great location, but rooms are VERY old and need to be renovated! Workers picketing out front.”
Reviews.Author: nct5x
Reviews.Content: The location is great and overlooks Grant Park. It was so easy to get cabs to go back and forth since it is on a main street near the park. The bell hops outside were very friendly and helpful. The Congress Plaza looks beautiful in the pictures online and in their brochures. The exterior and lobby have a early 20th century grandeur, but it probably hasn't been renovated since then. I would dare say the rooms were gross. The carpet was this old flat red carpet that looked 25 years old, and I kept my socks or shoes on in the room. The wall paper and curtains were a custom pattern of the Congress Plaza hotel, but also looked like it hadn't been changed in decades. My room had a strange door/window for the fire escape exit and it was very drafty near it, so I slept in the bed further from the wall. The beds seemed fairly new and were decently comfortable and there was a new flat screen tv. Otherwise, everything down to the pipes and walls need to be redone! One other thing to note is that the hotel workers have been on strike at that hotel for 7 years. When my colleagues arrived, the picketers yelled at them and said "Shame on You" when they walked in. While it didn't really bother them, that's not exactly the welcome you want to get when you enter a hotel. I only booked here because my other hotel was overbooked and cancelled my previous reservation. This was the only hotel reasonably priced and reasonably close to the convention at McCormick Place that had availability. However, I would only come back here if they updated the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: This place is dated and decrepit. Furniture is ready for Goodwill. Unattractive lobby. Chipped paint and tiny bathroom. Depressing. Good location does not make up for the run-down quality of the hotel. Stay somewhere else and use the good Chicago public transportation to get to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrendous”
Reviews.Author: BlazinRed
Reviews.Content: Enough said. There is a reason why there are so many bad reviews. Do not, under any circumstances, stay here! It really needs to be condemned. I've stayed in hotels all over North America as I travel for work. This hotel is by far the worst I've ever stayed in. I'd rather sleep on a park bench, at least there would not be bed bugs. Dark, dreary and nasty. I'll let my photos do the talking now...

Reviews.Title: “Stolen laptops at the hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaicho
Reviews.Content: We got our laptops and a digital camera stolen the 2nd night we stayed there.....The general manager never contacted us we never got any reports from them concerning the issue. All they offer was a free breakfast which is a joke since a night in this hotel is close to $200 a night!! I can buy my own breakfast any day!!!!! PS. The staff and even the hotel President were indifferent and unprofessional regarding this issue!!! WORSE EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst stay.. rooms were dirty .. poor service .. never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: nhonghorn13
Reviews.Content: checked in late due to a delayed traveling day and was given a smoking room in a part of the hotel called buckingham towers.. i dont smoke and had requested a non smoking .. the room reeked of smoke and the walls were paper thin . they were dirty and noisy due to the metro being outside my window.. when i complained about 5 minutes into getting in the room i was told there was no other rooms.. i checked out the next day and stayed in my sisters room .. we were gone all day and came back to the room not being clean the housekeeper was next door and i asked her if she could please clean our room next we had no clean towels and the trash was overflowing .. she stated she would we waited 1hour and no one came i went looking for her and she was off the floor.. i called to housekeeping and complained .. about 30 minutes later someone showed up it was now 6pm.. this hotel has had the employees on strike for 8 years with temp help working there .. i think that says it all..

Reviews.Title: “Old but classy”
Reviews.Author: Mopane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one short night (booked by the company) and had absolutely no problems. After reading some of the recent reviews I was nervous, but I truly wish I had booked this hotel for the rest of our stay in Chicago. The decor and structure of the room were obviously old and not in perfect condition, but the luxury of the hotel was definitely still there. There was a great view, a fantastic location, a large, clean and comfortable room and my only complaint (not particularly serious) was that many parts of the room looked dated with some fading paint. There was still a strike going on while I stayed here, but it was no big deal and did not interfere in any way--there were just a few people with signs out front. Parking was an extra charge as was Internet, but this seemed to be standard with many places I looked at downtown.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower room: tolerable - South Tower room: go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: froggerfan
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to have stayed in the North Tower which exceeded my very low expectations after reading such horrible reviews. However, my colleagues were stuck in the South Tower. Had I checked in to one of their rooms - I would have slept in my car. If you are reading reviews it is very likely the decent reviews had a room like mine which although old, was clean and acceptable. The bad reviews are likely from the poor souls who were relegated to the South Tower rooms. There are plenty of options in Chicago - go somewhere - anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sleep and Clean Shower”
Reviews.Author: kkaseb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel only because the price was right and the location was good. It was indeed old with ragged carpet and scratched surfaces. But we don't spend much time in the room when we visit Chicago, so I was happy that it was clean and the king bed was extremely comfortable. The first night was very quiet but on night two the room next door was occupied and it sounded like they were practically in the room with us, as the connecting door did not filter much noise. The rusty air conditioning unit was a little icky but the air that came out of it was just fine. I've stayed in several hotels at a similar level in Chicago and this one is about par for the course--some good points and some bad.

Reviews.Title: “A dump with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: slophry
Reviews.Content: How do they stay open? The place was a dump compared to other hotels. The location a was excellent and the I slept like a baby. Stay away from the food, especially the breakfast buffet. It was awful. It is very poorly run. The internet isn't free. Cheapest on Michigan Ave though. It was a very MOIST hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: aetoi
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews on this hotel in Tripadvisor go over the top. This hotel is not as bad as made out, neither is it the best hotel in Chicago!! Its important people tailor their expectations - this is at best a 3 star hotel so 3 star is what should be expected. My stay for 2 nights was fine - I expected 3 star and got 3 star. The hotel is a dated, old American style hotel. It had character. The room was clean, quiet and spacious. It had a flatscreen TV and everything I needed. The bed was super comfortable. The decor and some facilities were dated. The hotel itself has many rooms so in such a situation staff attention is limited - friendly on check in but no more contact thereafter which is fine in my view. I didn't have breakfast so cannot comment on food standard. Locationwise it can't be faulted and if you manage to get a room with lake view you will won't be disappointed. One disappointment is having to pay for internet access but I think that is an issue with American hotels in general. Overall I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN...WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: voxpopuli1
Reviews.Content: The staff is incompetent. The rooms are dark and dreary...some with no windows. the carpets reek of smoke and dust. The accommodations were bleak. i wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. No one deserves to pay $200 a night for a miserable hotel experience. Stay away...trust me...!

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: janied10
Reviews.Content: A group of three families traveled to Chicago for Lollapalooza 2010. It was the best and closest location to Grant Park but that is where the good remarks end. What a shame because the hotel is a historic building and has great potential. The rooms are not clean. They have old and broken down furniture. There is water damage on the walls. The rooms smell musty. I never wanted to take off my shoes as the carpet was not clean. I would never stay at this hotel again. And what is up with the second floor?

Reviews.Title: “What. A. Dump.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTO
Reviews.Content: The sad thing is that this could be such a dynamic place. Instead, it's just an old bag that's been around the block too many times. 1) Check in: they'll tell you you have parking...but forget to mention you have to pay for it. 2) You 'll get a nice view....of either another room across the courtyard or to the west, out over the railway tracks. Enjoy the trains-a-rumblin'!! (No doubt these are the rooms for those of us who have paid via Priceline.com.) 3) Water pressure? What's that? 4) How nice: a fire escape out my window. Well, there was no fire, but there were teenagers running up and down it at 3am. 5) Your door slams nice and tight. Too bad all the others do too: nice and LOUDLY. 6) The exercise room is downright creepy. But hey, at least it has (15-year-old) exercise machines. And they work! But wait...what's that? Cigarette fumes floating through the vents. Nice. Like that when I work out. 7) Don't look to close at the moldings and rugs and such: too depressing. 8) Hello and goodbye from the staff that doesn't smile? Not on your life. 9) Wifi? Heck, it's even free at Starbucks. But not here. $10/day, if you can believe it. Caveat emptor. I'm staying tonight at the Red Roof Inn nearby. $30 a night cheaper, just as convenient, much quieter and cleaner and modern.

Reviews.Title: “An okay stay - good location.”
Reviews.Author: amgatta
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Congress Plaza Hotel with a bunch of others for a summit. The hotel itself was beautiful, but the service wasn't exactly the best. The tub wouldn't drain and we had to call twice about it. A lot of other guests said they were experiencing similar problems. The location though was really awesome! If you don't plan on spending a ton of time in your room (which I didn't) then I think the bad parts could be acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “I actually reported them to the BBB and the Health Department. Don't stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ca6464
Reviews.Content: This hotel has terrible service, they don't follow health guidelines for injuries and the list goes on and on. I would never recommend anyone stay here. They are a flea bag motel, I wouldn't even consider this a hotel. Rooms are nasty!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: kats30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and my daughter was infected with tons of Bed Bug bites. I've been trying to complain to their head of Secuirty with no answer or returned phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience on soooo many levels.A nightmare actualy”
Reviews.Author: 46Chromeboy
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for the Lollapalooza music festival August 6-9 2010. We chose this hotel because we knew the location was perfect for getting back and forth to the festival quickly. So let me start by getting the one positive aspect out of the way:great location. It is situated right across from the entrance to Grant Park as well as being close to shops,food, museums,"el"train etc. Now,before I get to ripping this hotel,let me qualify by stating that I do realize that this is probably the busiest weekend of the year for the hotels in this area. There were an estimated 240,000 people who attended Lolla this year and the Congress was very full and very busy all weekend. So I kind of had it in mind that some of the usual services might be lacking. Anyway, the hotel is very old and it shows,but not in a charming way. There is a dank,musty,old smell that just breathes from the hallways and floors themselves. Our room was very disappointing, starting from the entrance door which had to be opened by ramming your shoulder into it, and nearly pulling your arm out of the socket to close it because the frame was so warped. The bed comfort was average,as were the sheets and pillows,nothing special. The room itself needed a paint job and the carpets were just plain worn. The toilet flushes twice when you only pushed the handle once and then if we didn't jiggle the chain it would continue running. Actually, the toilet was running when we came in. It was very hot this weekend so we looked forward to a nice A/C room. Guess what? The air was pre-set on what I would call a "low" setting and the knobs were broken off. Oh well,off we went to enjoy the music. Looking forward to a nice shower when we got back that night,why wasn't I shocked when the water started filling up inch by inch up to my ankles. Yep,clogged drain,unbelievable. We called the front desk...Nobody ever showed up. Housekeeping cleaned the room the first morning,never again after that. Also, this is something that may not be important to many people but it is to me and I think it should be to you as well. I am a member of a labor union and I was shocked when I got there and realized the Congress is being picketed (7 years running) for unfair labor practices. Believe me if there were rooms to be had somewhere else I would not have stayed there,everything was booked solid elsewhere because of Lollapalooza. Also my fault for not researching better. So to sum up, for so much to be so bad in the short amount of time we stayed, I would not recommend the Congress. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “chicago blues festival”
Reviews.Author: johnvGlasgowUk
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just across the road from grant park,very handy for the festival,and a very short walk to buddy guys legends club just round the corner on wabash street,chicago city centre i found easy to walk about.

Reviews.Title: “Charged us for preexisting damages!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea2587
Reviews.Content: My rating has nothing to do with the stay itself; we're not picky, and we loved the rate and location. A month after our stay, however, we saw that an extra $250.00 charge had been billed to our credit card. We had not been notified of the charges, and when we called the hotel they claimed that we had done damage to the mattress. I wish we had been more picky! Then we would have told them when we arrived that we didn't want to have a room with a torn mattress, and we would have been saved the indignity of being accused of causing the damage ourselves! I am disputing the charges with our credit card company, but the hotel has been less than cooperative in backing up their claim that the room was in pristine condition before our arrival. Avoid unless you plan on taking a photo record of your room's initial condition for legal purposes!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-No Problems”
Reviews.Author: Debi8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Chicago and stayed 2 nights at The Congress hotel. Yes it's an old hotel with a classic turn of the century look with the lobby and main floor taking you back in time. But it was clean and the desk clerks and concierge were pleasant and helpful. Our room was a family suite, and was very spacious, with a king size bed in it's own room and 2 full size beds in the main room. The ceilings were about 12 feet high which made the room feel even bigger. There was some peeling paint on the doors ( which must have been very old). The bathroom was fine and everything functioned properly. The service was great. We needed towels and they were brought up in 5 minutes. Our TV remote was missing from the room where the king size bed was and they had one up to us in like 2 minutes! The location is also great. It is right across from Grant Park (with it's awesome fountain), and walking distance to the Shedd Aquarium (about a mile), Art Museum (3 blocks), Millenium Park (4 blocks), and other attractions. One con was the parking garage set up that just wasn't designed for todays traveler, but just deal with it. Another con was that you will hear the El Train outside till about midnight then again in the morning but it wasn't too bad. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet surprise”
Reviews.Author: MsafiriTexas
Reviews.Content: PROS I was scared of going to this hotel based on reviews. What a sweet surprise! Clean, well kept, antique look and feel, solid construction and EXTREMELY QUIET; seems even dividing walls are made of concrete or something close. Very spacious too. Reasonably priced in an excellent location in Chicago - on the touristy Michigan avenue and overlooking a beautiful park. CONS Internet and breakfast cost extra

Reviews.Title: “Kept getting worse”
Reviews.Author: electricpineapple
Reviews.Content: High class amenities like: Styrofoam cups, dated style, ugly rooms. Staff removed shampoos and soap the second day of my stay. The next day my key card did not work in the door after working all day. Went to the desk and asked why it didn't work and she said that I might have had the key next to metal or other cards. Well they originally gave me two keys, the second was sitting in my room in the envelope the entire time, that key also didn't work. Would not stay here again. You can still find cheaper prices for nicer hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: willmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a college visit. Easy parking and check in - room was ready early. Lobby is nice and spacious with beautiful historic marble work. The double courtyard room in the North tower was adequate, clean and quiet. However, it looked as old as it is with very poor detailing. The wall mounted TV was on a flimsy swivel mount with loads of dangling wires hanging below. The remote, channel quality and reception were poor. The room had lots of poorly fitting and damaged molding. There was a door in the room which I assume was to an adjoining room - it was locked shut by screws drilled through the door and into the frame. The bathroom was clean with the exception of a little grout mold. It was poorly lit and the bathtub was only about four feet wide - they don't make them like that any more! If you need a hotel in the south loop it is OK if the price is right. It is good for sleeping, getting ready and heading out. I would not go here for a romantic getaway or if you expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again....No Problem”
Reviews.Author: chimmicat
Reviews.Content: Okay, My husband and I just returned from a 5 day trip with another couple. We stayed from July 2nd-7th. This was a great location as the hotel sits right across from Grant Park. I booked this hotel based on location as the Chicago food festival was being held at Grant Park and we had originaly planned to see U2 perform at Soldier Field. The hotel is a easy and safe walking distance from Soldier Field. You can easily walk the Musuem Campus ( Field, Shedd) from the hotel. It is also a easy walk to The Art Institute and Millenium Park. The Chicago Trolley Hop On/Hop Off tour bus stop is close to the hotel. You can pick it up in Front of the Hilton or Millinium Park. Okay, First the hotel is old, it was built in the early 1900"s........so if some chipping paint (honestly how many times do you think it has been painted) and antique furniture is not your thing....well the Hitlon is next door. The bathroom was modern and we had a towel rack, but we noticed our friends did not in their room. The also had a walk in closet and we did not. Our room was very spacious with high ceilings. It was very clean......no odors at all. Very Clean. We had plenty of room in the closet and the dresser to store our clothes. Lots of room to walk around. It was not cramped at all. We had no problem staying here. The door was old......reminded me of my Grandmothers house. I found it charming as did the other couple traveling with us. They had no complaints about their room. The hallway was quiet, so noise except for occasional city noise, which the A/C drowned out. Room service responded promptly when we called down for extra pillows. The Iron was broken,but we just borrowed the one from our friends. We loved the view of Grant Park, and the Shedd Aquarium. The hotel had a restuarant but we did not eat there, but did have a drink in the bar. It was quiet crowded in the bar. There is a Dunkin Donuts and a Corner Bakery down the street, along with some other eateries. We had good service at a place called the Artist Cafe the first visit, but left from poor service the second day. We did eat at a great Pizza place called Pizano's Pizza and Pasta. Highly recommend them......they are located at 864 N. State St......number is [-----] We had a nice Bartender named Kat from Indiana.......the food was great as was the service. I would also recommend the Chicago Trolley Tours. We walked a lot and it was nice to have the trolley to pick you up when the feet started to get tired. Also their is a blues club behind the Hilton which is next to the Congress Plaza.........Oh, the beds are firm. I am not a fan of real firm mattresses, but geez I was exhausted by the end of the day, by all the walking that I did not care and easily fell asleep. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Oh, you have free wifi in the room, but have to pay for internet service downstairs. But they do have one computer that only acess the airlines, so you can check in and get your boardin pass printed.......for no charge. That was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: BluesTravler_10
Reviews.Content: You are only paying for location, let me repeat "You are only paying for location". The hotel is old and musty. My room was clean but creepy. The floor had been shampooed so much that you could see the vacuum streaks in the carpet. That led me to believe that it was a dirty room. I was afraid to take my shoes off for fear that the carpet was wet. That is how bad the carpet looked. Not only could you see the coils in the mattress when you pulled the sheets back, you could definitely feel them. I am not use to staying in old hotel and this one gave me the creeps. The safe box did not function properly. If you plan on not staying in your room or getting any sleep in Chicago then this hotel might work out for you. But, if you are use to opening the hotel door and seeing a room that that you can imagine in your house-THEN THIS HOTEL IS NOT THE ONE FOR YOU!!!! I switch hotel for the following nights and could actually get some rest. It's is not a dirty hotel just OLD!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls - horrible service - horrible rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dmpeaceman
Reviews.Content: What can I say good about this hotel? Not much. I ended up being next to a family with a screaming kid. The parents couldn't keep him quiet, and due to the EXTREME paper thin walls I heard every word of their conversation, as well as the screaming child ALL night. And I'm not exagerrating...it was the worst from 1am to 5:30am. Now, this of course isn't the hotels fault....but I asked to be moved to another room, and they wouldn't do it. They would send up security that wouldn't do anything. I asked for a refund at the front desk due to the terrible experience, and got 10$ off my bill. WHOOPIE! Really quite mean people. Next up was the toilet, it was broken, and wouldn't stop running....so I had to open the tank and shove a pen in the stopper so it would shut up. Then there's the room...I get in, and the AC had been running continuously, so it was freezing. Also the front of the hotel was lined with picketers! I really can't say enough bad things about this hotel....stay FAR FAR away

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: ChrisD48
Reviews.Content: I could not agree more, than with SusanK_OD from Portage IN. The experience was miserable--and the smell was the worst. We complained to our booking agent, Last Minute Travel, seaking reembursement for the awful experiance. Their "investigation amounted to asking Congerss management to check out the rooms. I was Schocked!, Schocked!! I tell you to discover that we were sadly mistaken. In fact we were in a grand smell free historic hotel that had renovated bathrooms. Yah, renovated sometime in the last half of the last century. If you have other choices take them, and never trust booking to Last Minute Travel.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ireteri
Reviews.Content: First, it's a great location. I took the train from the airport and walked the few blocks to the hotel. However, I was greated by picketers. Apparently there has been a strike here for years. I walked into a very formal grand lobby, but while it truly is spectactular, the furniture is old, red leather couches. The bar/lounge feels straight out of the 50's. There are ballrooms that are jaw dropping but then you get the feeling that this place is a beautiful, wealthy woman dressed in rags. It's a strange mix. The rooms are from the thirty's. The bed stands, the dressers, etc. seem newer but the style reminds me of '30s style. There are very tall doors with huge curved plastered ceilings. The walls, curtains, and sheets all have monograms of the hotel which is kind of cool. There is a small flat screened tv with a remote. However the carpet is industrial red and the bathroom is a mess. It was clean enough, but the tiles are not real and this was evident because the edges were not sealed. There were no towel racks either to hang towels. I slept well and felt the room was clean. One other oddity was that I was cold when I walked in. I looked for a thermostat to turn off the air or add a little heat. I couldn't find one. There was a register under the window with air coming out of it. I figured out how to open it and could turn the fan off. However, I never found heat. The coffee maker worked well and it was better than most in room coffee as were the shampoos. As to recomending this? I'm on the fence. I love history and was drawn in to all the really impressive old elements that you never see in hotels now. Kind of like the Grand Hotel in Macinack Island, but not as kept up. It's a good price, Near everything you'd need in Chicago, but a feeling of disappointment at the aging of a beautiful piece of history. I might go back if price were a big factor. Definately don't think this is a high end experience. It's a mix of experiences that you can imagine were once top shelf.

Reviews.Title: “You are only paying for location.......nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Columbus9
Reviews.Content: I traveled with three other girlfriends for a fun weekend in Chicago. The location of this hotel can't be beat, you are on Michigan Avenue and directly across the street from Grant Park, Millenium Park, and Buckingham Fountain. Now, to get to any of the fun, young parts of town we either had to walk more than a mile (which was fine) or take a cab. So, I would not recommend this to anyone who can't walk a ways or afford to take a cab. The lobby is lovely and I checked in in mere minutes. Then I headed to my room......yikes. First of all my room was miles away from the lobby. I had to take an elevator and then travel through 3 different long hallways. The hallways are shabby and smell. The doors to get through these hallways are beaten up and scary looking. The room was adequate to accomodate the four of us but it was a dump. It needs a major update. There were two flat screen tvs but one of them didn't work. Someone did come and fix it luckily. The bathroom door only had a door knob on one side, I have no idea what happened to the other half. We didn't have hot water unless you ran the water for about 10 minutes and the first time I ran the shower rust came out. I wouldn't ever stay here again unless it was dirt cheap. We payed $209 a night for a two bedroom room. What a dump!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: angelared
Reviews.Content: I really cannot praise this hotel enough. My husband and I arrived before lunch time, and enquired if we could store our luggage until check-in time; absolutely no problem, in fact we were checked in, and shown to our room, despite arriving 2 hours early. Minor problem opening the safety deposit box - phoned reception and it was tended to immediately. Room was spacious - we had booked a lakeview king room - with a bay window from which we could see from Navy Pier to the Field Museum, and everything in between! Bed very comfortable, linens crisply laundered, bathroom clean and functional, air conditioning/heating worked as it is meant to. There was a table and 2 chairs, as well as a desk area and flat screen TV. The whole room looked and smelled clean. I do agree with previous reviewers, in that this lovely old place is a little dated, and in need of some TLC, however, it's faded charm is still clearly visible. I did not notice any unpleasant smells, in hallways or in our room, and whilst a lick of paint may well be needed, the place certainly doesn't look dowdy! If you plan on spending only a short time in your hotel room, this is an ideal hotel to book; if you prefer more opulent (and therefore more expensive) surroundings, look further up Michigan Ave. The location is fantastic, easy walking distance to Michigan Avenue Bridge/shopping,Art Institute, Millenium Park, Field Museum and Shedd Aquarium. Buckingham Fountain and Grant Park are directly in front. The staff in the lobby, and bar were friendly but courteous. We checked out after a very pleasing 2 night stay, and made the short walk to the Metra station, which took us directly to O'Hare airport. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view, prime location - but needs a restoration”
Reviews.Author: lostinthesupermarket
Reviews.Content: The Pros: We booked on line directly with the hotel website - Perfect. Check-in was late night - Quick but not warm and fuzzy. We got a King room on the 14th floor with an incredible view - very quiet room. Comfy bed, decent linens, excellent hot water/pressure in shower. Ample storage and decent size room for an old hotel. Great high ceilings and beautiful windows. Check-out quick and accurate on the flat screen TV. Cabs easy to hail - walk to the Art Institute. The Cons: Not a destination hotel - its a go to your room and then leave to sightsee kind of place. Odd smell in hallways but not in room. Weird RED carpet in room. Picketers are lame. Toiletries/Room Amenities passable. Summary: I would not stay there with my children - but it worked ok for a couples weekend away when we weren't spending much time at the hotel. I'm nicer than my husband who said it was a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and location second to none”
Reviews.Author: pkbptw
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location and for the price it was one of the best values in Chicago. The hotel has charm (it is an older hotel) but it is well maintained and the beds were fantastic and there really wasn't anything negative about the stay. Would definitely recommend to a friend and will stay at the hotel again whenever I come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Tired property and poor service stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: SusanK_OD
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during Memorial Day weekend. We waited over 30 minutes in line just to check in - two kiosks to do electonic self check-in but both were broken. The rooms are very tired and in need of a make over. Funky smell hit you in the face right outside of the elevator and was there our entire time. Parked a car paid $33 which were told by Hotels.com was included in our rate (but was not) and waited another 35 minutes just to get our car from the garage. Poor service and an attitude of not caring. We stayed here because we decided at the last minute and had few options on a holiday weekend but should have looked harder. i strongly suggest you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, avoid.”
Reviews.Author: Ken048
Reviews.Content: A ghastly run down scruffy dump, with dimly lit rooms and corridors you can easily get lost in. Plus you'll have to cross a union picket of the poorly paid workers who are in dispute with the hotel management, not something I would have been willing to do if I had been forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than some reviews lead you to believe”
Reviews.Author: ryguyatlanta
Reviews.Content: So I read all the reviews and came away really confused about this hotel. Some saying it is awful. Some saying great. Some saying scary. Who knew what the truth was. Well, I got a good deal for 3 adults and decided to take my chances. Personally, I was hoping the hotel was a little 'ghostly' as some reviews seemed to indicate. That idea actually intrigued me. Also, keep in mind as you read this review that I'm not the kind of person who is into a meticulous, sterile, hotel-chain experience devoid of any kind of personality. I'm not opposed to that, but I do prefer a unique and unusual experience. So on with the review now.... We arrived at the hotel (easy to find) and found the lobby to be very stately, attractive, and clean. Somebody mentioned the ugly red chairs/sofas. I thought they looked just fine and fit the look of the hotel. Also at this location there are several restaurants nearby, drug-stores, and every half-block or so you'll find a Dunkin-Donuts -- they're everywhere! I arrived at 10:00am (check-in is at 3:00pm) and asked if I could store my bags until 3:00pm. At that point the clerk said if there was a room available right now, then we could check-in in advance. Sure enough a room was available. I noticed a sign on the counter offering a lake-view room upgrade for $25/night. She had some available and so I went with that. I thought it would be worth it. The entire check-in process went very smoothly and the clerk was extremely polite and friendly. I encountered the same friendly and helpful service from the concierge and bellman throughout my stay. Still looking good. We went up to the room and were delighted with the view and the room was just fine. Two double beds and an average-sized room. Then I walked into the bathroom to check it out and I stepped into water on the floor. It covered a good deal of the floor, but thank goodness it was clean water. Not sure where it came from, but I immediately went back to the checkout counter to explain the situation. They apologized profusely and offered to put me into another room for same cost. This time it was on the 12th floor North tower (old room was 5th floor South tower). All of this was taken care of in just a few minutes and I was completely satisfied with the way they handled it. I went back up to get my friends and luggage and seek out the new room. We headed up the elevators -- yes they are old, but I actually loved them. They are smallish perhaps, but perfectly functional and relatively quick and smooth, and just have and old, grand feel to them. No complaints there. We got to the room and opened the door and we fell in love immediately. The view was breath-taking. Several HUGE energy-efficent windows (which also opened partially) with an incredible view onto Buckingham fountain and Lake Michigan, the Navy Pier and Field Museum areas. The room was huge and had 2 king size beds that faced each other. It was an unusual arrangement but I really like it. It had a flat panel tv, coffee-maker, hair-dryer, iron, etc (but no fridge). It was perfecly clean (as the previous room was also). The bed linens and pillows were very nice and upscale/soft. We couldn't have been happier. The room did not smell funny as some people mentioned in other reviews. Honestly there was nothing to complain about. High ceilings, lots of natural light, incredible views, tons of space to walk, huge comfortable beds, two desks, a table, etc. The only thing I'd really say was marginal about the room was the bathroom. Understand that I was just fine with the bathroom, as it was perfectly functional. However, I must say whoever picked out the tile was either color blind or just plain blind. And the tile job must've been done by somebody's uncle. But honestly, none of that affects the usefulness of the bathroom. To give you an idea of what it looked like -- The floor was done in a beige fake-cobblestone tile (home depot cheapo tile). The walls were fake gray/white marble, with a trim tile that had a weird pattern in blue that matched nothing (also cheapo tiles). And none of the tile edges were finished properly. It was like and ugly puppy though, you still had to love it. The bathtub was quite nice -- fairly new and quite deep. It drained just fine as well. The toilet and sink were nothing to write home about, but again, both functioned fine. So close your eyes if your senses are offended -- but seriously, it was just fine and it gives you something to chuckle about. Now some people said the hallways were creepy and smelly, etc. I wandered a couple hallways, including the 12th floor. Yeah, maybe a bit of a musty smell at times, but honestly, the carpet was clean, the walls were clean, and it just smelled maybe a bit old, but nothing unhealthy at all. It didn't bother me. I did not find the hallways to be creepy or haunted feeling either. All in all, everything seemed just fine. Just don't expect a 4-5 star experience. Also, others mentioned the lack of control over heat/cold in the rooms and lack of hot water in bathroom. I had none of those problems. I could heat & cool the room just fine (it had two heat/ac units in it) and the hot water arrived in the shower very quickly. Finally, check-out time arrived. The bill was quietly slipped under the door and all the charges added up exactly as expected. I didn't use room service, or internet, or eat at the hotel, so I had no added charges. You can check-out from your room or at the front desk and it was very efficeint. Now why was my stay so differnt from some others on here? I don't know. Maybe they keep improving rooms. Maybe I got a really nice upgrade. I believe there are probably some bad rooms in the hotel and somebody gets stuck in those eventually. If you do, then just ask for another room. I tend to think maybe the lake view rooms may be nicer, since they go for more money, but not sure about that. I would definitely recommend you checkout this hotel if you fit the following criteria: a) you like a good deal; b) you like a good location (Grant Park); c) you are not an anal-retentive, everything-must-be-perfect kind of person who demands the finest of everything; d) you don't mind taking a chance and actually prefer things that are a bit unique or unusual. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “I got robbed at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SchnitzelOrlando
Reviews.Content: I was robbed at this hotel # 1133 by the cleaning crew. May 19th 2010. They took my gold watch and all medication while I left my room for 10 minutes. When I got back the "Do not disturb" sign on my door was flipped over. At first I did not think twice and forgot about it. The next day I remembered the suspicious behavior of the three cleaning people next to my room in the hall way. I checked my toiletry bag and found my watch and medication gone. Do not stay there. Bad hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Rough Diamond - You Have to Want to Stay Here -- But Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: ogion
Reviews.Content: This place is phenomenal and a dive -- at the same time. In the "+" column ... 1) Right on Grant Park - a part of the Chicago lakefront skyline -- Lake view rooms look out at Buckingham Fountain (Emeril sez "Bam!") 2) Right on Grant Park --- walk to Wacker, Navy Pier, Museums, Loop --- wow! 2) Price - we paid $125 for a huge room with a lake view over Easter weekend 3) Safe --- drunks in park across the way -- but it is on Michigan Avenue -- no worries. 4) View 5) View 6) View In the "-" column ... 1) Doors, room walls and hall carpets look like they came from a run down tenement house But ... beds have been redone (a little hard for me but nice) and bathrooms have been refurbished (nice but not crazy nice) Parking lot around the back -- very friendly and safe (secure) Like I said -- you have to WANT to stay here --- but honestly --- I liked the place before they renovated -- wouldn't stay anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Retro Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: KmomChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. The hotel has preserved a lot of original detail while keeping up with modern requirements. There is a time warp quality and it is so easy to see how specatcular this place was when it was built for the great Columbian Exhibition in 1893. It's really cool, but really old. It feels old and a bit faded. That is surely why it is such a great bargain for its location on Grant Park with breathtaking Lake Michigan views. If you enjoy history and character over sterile snootiness, this is your place. Check the hotel website for pricing - sometimes the lake view rooms are only a few dollars more than standard.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: berts4
Reviews.Content: One of my girlfriends and my two teenagers (13 & 16) stayed here since we were participating in the St. Patrick's Day Parade. We arrived at about 10 am, before the parade, and Margarita was nice enough to let us check in early. The first room we were given (1085) was WAY too small for the four of us. It had two double beds and about 2 feet of walking room around and between them. I called down and asked if there was anything that might fit us four "big people" better. Margarita sent us to room 1381 wich was PERFECT!!!! It was actually a small suite with a king bed and larger area in the main room, a short hallway with bathroom in the middle and a very small room with a double bed at the end. It was on the corner of the building. (I'm not sure if the fact that I was wearing my "Trip Advisor" hat had anything to do with this upgrade.) Flat screen TVs in both rooms seemed to work ok, only the video check out did not. The picketers were no issue and the doorman was excellent! The hotel IS older and the hallways DO look like "The Shining", but we liked these things. There was NO noise and we slept very soundy. The king bed was very comfortable. We had NO issues with hot water or plumbing either. I would stay there again, but the price was awfully high (total of $ 180.00+ for the one night). That was understandable since it was St. Patty's weekend. I needed a refridgerator and the charge was $ 10.00. Not excessive, but these days, most hotels have them included. We have decided that we will stay downtown a couple of times per year, and if the price was right, we would stay here again as the location is great. The veiw would have been better, but if was very foggy. In the morning, my son realized that the Willis (Sears) Tower was right outside the "little room's" window.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JenniferT15
Reviews.Content: The History And Architeture Of This Hotel Is Amazing

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Ambobrock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Service is great rooms are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Really...It is a neat place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lmwpac
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary because of some of the negative reviews but we decided that it looked like a cool place to stay, it was a unique piece of the Chicago landscape, and 'hey, why not?'. What a treat. It is a grand hotel for folks that do not need the security of staying in a cookie cutter establishment. I felt the charm and beauty of a truly magnificent building. The ceilings, floors, fixtures, elevators, furniture all are what you would expect out of a place whose heyday was in the 1930's / 40's. Don't miss the opportunity to stay in a hotel like this. Soon they will all be gone - replaced by trendy boutiques, chains with no individual charm, and B&B's. Sure it is an old place but it was spotlessly clean with helpful, friendly staff. Room furniture is ok and bed is not as comfortable as my own but not terrible either. Nice but smallish soaking tub in the bath (in fact bath seemed to be entirely new). When we asked for places to eat we were directed to good local places. Everyone smiled, everyone helped us. The union strike was still going on. Not sure what the problem is but the people working in the hotel were super and appeared quite happy. The strikers seem to be trying to make the chain hotels win. Now that I have been there, I really do think that a lot of the negative reviews are coming from the union folk. I just can't see how the experiences could be so discrepant. Anyway, stay here. Get a Lake View room (otherwise what is the point and I do think that the train noise would be loud on the other side of the hotel). Soak up the atmosphere. Enjoy the hotel crest on everything - I mean everything. Go to a blues club. Eat a Chicago dog (who puts tomato slices on hot dogs...but very yummy). Get some beer and sushi (great place a block or so up the street) and shoot pool in the lounge. Revel in the coolness of the place. It's not perfect but it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: weddingbelles
Reviews.Content: I am honnestly surprised that this hotel doesn't rank higher...I guess that just speaks to the generally high quality of hotels in the windy city! This place has to be my favorite though -- great rooms, generous amentiies, killer location,incredibly helpful staff, and superb value! I MUCH prefer it to the nearby Palmer House hilton (which is compartitively very cramped and cheap (charged me $15 a day for the coffee maker!))-- which bewildering ranks so muh higher. This is way better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: beachray2
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews, my family and I were prepared for the worst! However the hotel was so much better than expected. We checked in around 5:30pm very easily. Staff was friendly and luckily since my father does some work for the Congress we were able to get the employee discount of $35.00 a night which was excellent. The hotel lobby looks a little out of place. The furniture(red leather couches) are a bit too modern but it is full of charm. The hotel hallways seem a bit creepy and dreary. Obviously carpet needs to be replaced, the lights are dim, and the wall paper looks like its been there since the hotel opened in the 1890s. The rooms sure are a sight to see! They are old but I believe this is part of the experience of staying here. The ceilings first of all are the highest I have ever seen in a hotel room. At least 18 ft. high. Everything seemed very clean and you have to understand that this hotel is old. Paint is chipping off the closet door, the bath tub is short but this is nothing that should ruin your trip. The view from our room was to die for. We had a lake view room and was the most amazing view we had ever had from a chicago hotel. Straight ahead was Grant Park and the beautiful lake. To the left was the city and navy pier and to the right was the museum campus. Just gorgeous! However at night you could hear a little bit of city traffic but was not bad at all! Overall we had an excellent time over our one night stay. The only complaints from my family was that my mom and sister complained their king bed wasn't very comfortable, however my double was just fine. The people who park your car are a little rude and pushy but I guess they can get away with it since it is the only place to park. Lastly the hotel seems a little creepy and haunted. My sister went on a ghost hunting tour and the Congress was one of the stops. However we didn't let that scare us and we everyone had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared off by poor reviews -- this place is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: SChy
Reviews.Content: You know, I almost cancelled my reservation at Chicago's Congress Plaza based on the reviews here. I'm so glad I didn't. It's not a 'luxury' hotel, but for $100, we had a perfectly clean room, good sized room, & tastefully decorated with a beautiful lake view in a location that couldn't have been better. The staff was friendly and always very helpful & courteous. All the amenities worked just as well as any other hotel I've stayed at. For a perfectly great hotel at only $100, a short walk from so much of fantastic Chicago, I don't get what the poor reviews are for unless they are from bitter ex-employees or strikers. Seriously, folks. If you're interested in location & value, the Congress Plaza is a great choice. Don't let these reviews scare you off!

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: did book this hotel as the offer with 87$ excl.tax was one of the cheapest fares for good located hotels. Room was nice, had some charm. Unfortunalty Internet ist expensive. But just 1 block away is a coffee with free wifi, so paying is not worth....

Reviews.Title: “Aweful place, charged my card more than what was shown on the invoice at checkout..”
Reviews.Author: pxd2010
Reviews.Content: a nightmare hotel, loud protest at the door..poor housekeeping, high charges for internet and not only that unfriendly staff, i checked out early and my invoice did not reflect the early checkout fee, I submitted to my company for reimbursement only to discover incidently that i was charged more than what i was shown, no one asked me or informed me but just charged my account after i was gone. on calling them i was told that they have no record of my check out after a lot of calling they were finally able to find the record of my check out, but there only response was ok we will send you a new reciept. realllly unprofessional staff..if you want peace of mind and dont have time to waste on phone calls avoid this hotel as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room, value for money”
Reviews.Author: hoezo
Reviews.Content: After reading revieuws on tripadvisor we were a little anxious about the hotel, but what a nice surprise! We were 3, and our room was like a suite with 2 separate bedrooms. Bathroom was clean, towels refreshened every day. Top location!! Staff was friendly, and rooms very quiet. We will certainly stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off. Get a lake view room.”
Reviews.Author: huntertibs
Reviews.Content: At the end of five weeks travelling we took a punt on this one. The King Room with lake view was worth every penny, and it wasn't really that expensive. We loved this place. A bit like a colourful aunt who has had plastic surgery along the way and some of it has gone a bit wrong. Sure the renovations don't quite match and the painters clearly took numerous long lunches. The room and bathroom were clean and fresh, the bed comfortable and the view to die for. Superb little breakfast place just down the road (turn left at the entrance, you'll know it when you get there). Centrally located and everything we were looking for in a one night stopover before we boarded the California Zephyr. Would go back again. Staff friendly and helpful although we don't understand why this place has been targetted by the Unionists - our understanding was that very few workplaces in the USA allow Union membership?

Reviews.Title: “Works for the Price”
Reviews.Author: norwayChicago
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but less expensive than most and gets you to the part of Chicago you want to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Make up your own mind”
Reviews.Author: patsy123
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I spent 2 nights at the Congress Plaza on the way to Nashville for a Sweet Adelines Barbershop competition. This was meant to give a couple of days to adapt to the time difference and get into the American way of doing things. I have to say we had a great time at the Congress Plaza. The location was the fab, close to everything you need and plenty of taxis, tour buses if you dont want to walk. The interior of the Congress Plaza is very stylish and although a little tired still has that good feeling factor. The staff were extremely friendly and the beds were the most comfortable we had all week - including the ones at the Marriot hotel at London Heathrow. The bedroom was spacious and plenty of room for 4 adults to get round, although the wardrobe would not be enough if the stay was longer than a couple of days. On the down side the position of the bathroom was too close to the bedroom and the bedroom wasnt cleaned between the 2 nights. We had to ask for clean toweels but the staff were very amenable and nothing was too much trouble. On balance we would definitely stay here again. In spite of the corridors reminding us of The Shining and us expecting the twins coming round the corner - 'come play with us'. We had a lot of fun at the Congress Plaza and would recommend it to anyone as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SkipCa
Reviews.Content: Maybe there are nice rooms here, but certainly not on the backside, where the El goes by every 2 minutes, just beyond the 400-car parking lot outside the window. Stalinist architecture, Stalinist decor. If there is an amenity to skip, they do: including hot water and clean coffee makers. Styrofoam cups, one packet of bad coffee, pay for your own Internet, & if you want to watch tv in bed, bring binoculars - my iPhone almost has a bigger screen. The lounge is a dive; the restaurant is worse.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price. Great for just sleeping.”
Reviews.Author: alpxidelt1893
Reviews.Content: We went with a group of 4 women for a girls weekend. The location is great-within walking distance of Grant Park and Michigan Ave. The hotel is older--the front desk and lobby is beautiful. The rooms are a little run down. We actually found a condom wrapper hidden inside the phone book!! The beds are a little firm but pillow are nice. The room was clean and the bathroom was also. The bathroom was actually a nice size. We had a double full-size room. The view was ok-just a peak of Grant park. Apparently the other side of the hotel has beautiful views of the water. Bell service was a little slow when we went to leave, but overall a nice stay. If you want a hotel for all kinds of amenaties and have room service, spa and whatever, this probably isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Only if price is a concern....”
Reviews.Author: aledford
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Chicago Marathon and selected the hotel because of its location right across the street from the start/finish line of the marathon, and because it was much cheaper than other nearby hotels. We were there for 3 nights. Pros: location is great (close to the train system/public transportation, Field/Shedd Aquarium, Art Institute walking distance, right across the street from the race), the room was not dirty, the flat screen TV was nice with more cable channels that we've had at some other hotels, we had water pressure (painfully so much water pressure at times), they allowed us to check in super early (10 a.m.), after checking out, we were able to leave our luggage with the bell man and pick it up later in the afternoon. Cons: the room and decor was extremely dated and not really pleasant to be in, the bed was like someone draped a sheet over asphalt, not just firm/hard - we could also feel individual springs, we were provided with only 2 cheap pillows total, so propping yourself up in bed to watch TV at night was uncomfortable, and the pillows were about 6 inches high with no give, so they were uncomfortable to sleep on, the radiator/heater in the room sounded like two squirrels were fighting all night (loud thunking noises) we were placed in the "Buckingham" wing on the second floor, so we heard EVERYTHING- including a fight that broke out between two cabbies, constantly honking horns, the train, and the best was at 12:30 a.m. the night before the marathon, the picketers mentioned in other reviews who came through banging buckets, tooting whistles, blowing air horns and shouting/chanting. This lasted for about an hour. Between the uncomfortable bed, heater/radiatior and picketers, I didn't sleep well any of the 3 nights we stayed there. To be fair, friends who stayed there at the same time for the marathon in other rooms didn't have the same noise issues I did. However, after my uncomfortable stay, I would pay the extra money to stay somewhere nicer and not stay there again. Just not a comfortable experience. If you're taking a chance with this hotel due to location/cost, just ask NOT to be placed in the Buckingham wing.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay & never quite as good”
Reviews.Author: CABRN55
Reviews.Content: This was the last time that I stayed at the Congress Plaza Hotel. I have stayed there two other times, the first time in March of 2007. I chose this hotel because it was within a block of the campus of a college my son wanted to attend the following semester and I had never been to Chicago. Having lived in a large city and overseas in the past, I knew that driving and walking in unknown territory can be unwise when unfamiliar, I chose to be situated nearby to reduce the need for transportation as much as possible. I chose the Congress Plaza based on ratings, price, and location. My first stay was very favorable. The room was much nicer than I had expected. The staff was kind, friendly and very helpful. I found Chicago to be one of the most pleasant cities I have ever visited and I was delighted with the college that my son and his current undergraduate university had recommended. My first stay was a 3 night stay. I returned again in August, 2007 with my son and this time, my husband in tow. I was excited to show my husband not only the wonderful school his son would be attending but also the marvelous vistas of the lake and Grant Park with it's many museums, statues, and beautiful landscaping. When we arrived, we were assigned to a room at the most remote end of this enormous building, next to what I was told was the "smoking" annex of the hotel. Our "view" was a narrow alley that spanned approximately 15 feet to a windowless brick wall of another building. Over the course of the next three days, we endured our air conditioning malfunctioning with no apparent concern from hotel management to having a Chicago policeman knock on our door and demand that we pay 75 dollar per night because he was told we were smoking in the room. My final stay was in October of 2008 and while things weren't as bad, the room was still awful. Next time, I'm going to stay farther out. I'm used to Chicago now. I know where things are and am used to the mass transit system there. Staying on the Magnificant Mile is convenient and beautiful, but is either extraordinarily expensive or downright shoddy. Next time, I go for the in between and stay at one of the reasonbly priced and handsomely maintained hotels in one of the excellent neighborhoods nearby downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Congress Plaza is a lot better than some people say on this site.”
Reviews.Author: twinsn2cats
Reviews.Content: We chose the Congress on 3 factors: 1) it is in prime location in the loop, 2) it was the cheapest in that area-and anywhere downtown for that matter, and 3) the couple we traveled with stayed there in the spring. Our family of 4 (including twin 7 yr olds) liked it and would stay there again. We had clean rooms, yes they were old, but it seemed full of character. We had quick delivery of towels when we asked for more. The price was only $189/night. We walked everywhere we could; there was a Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, and a Corner Bakery close by for mornings, and we shopped our way to the Hershey store on the other end of Michigan Ave. We did figure out the bus system for our trip to MSI and our night return from Navy Pier. It was around the corner and 1 short block from the train station (South Shore). The people at the hotel were nice enough...We had no complaints! Wait...we did: no Disney Channel, but we had a portable DVD player and watched a movie instead.

Reviews.Title: “Old, run down rooms. Expected more.”
Reviews.Author: technochino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in early October. When I first arrived to do an early check in, the staff helped me with my request, but were not the most congenial or welcoming staff I had encountered. I was placed in an even numbered room on the 11th floor. The room had a decent city view, which became a problem which I will explain later. The king sized bed was decent but springy. The windows would only open 3 inches and the room would get uncomfortably warm at night due to the lack of temperature controls. The flat screen tv was adequate. The bathroom appeared worn, tucked into a small corner of the room adjacent to the bedroom. It was cramped and you could tell that they just replaced the floor with plastic waterproof "tile" on the floors and walls but you still see the cracks in the walls. The tub was slightly slanted so water which splashed on the sides would leak onto the floors. This was remedied by placing a towel on the floor. In the morning we were woken up by the numerous trains bringing people to the downtown loop. On the orange line, the "Library" stop is closest (about 3 blocks away) making it convenient to Midway Aiport (about 35 mins). That saved us money on a cab. We did not try the room service but did get a decent dinner salad from the downstairs steakhouse. The hotel is close to a Dairy Queen which is on the corner. A Starbucks is 2 blocks North of the hotel. Location is a plus as it is right on S Michigan Ave and we took a few walks up to N Michigan Ave where a lots of shops were located. Internet is available in the rooms. You have to pay for internet in the lobby as well. Overall, the hotel is old, service was subpar with location being the only redeeming quality of this hotel. I would not stay here again nor would I recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snorris98
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and it was a nice older hotel (with I am sure lots of history behind it). The room was HUGE and bed was nice, we also had a great view of the fountain. It seemed like we never heard anyone come or go so that was nice b/c alot of times you hear doors slamming. One tip is if you have a car to park it your self, you will save some $$$ rather then using valet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great service”
Reviews.Author: folgema
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely, carpet and all linens were clearly new. Bed was comfortable, towels were plush, carpet was plush. Yes, there were some picketers at front, but they ignored us, and we ignored them. Location was incredible, we walked to concert at Soldier Field, and many museums were within walking distance. Our hairdryer didn't work, they replaced it within moments of our call to front desk. The room next door lit up a cigarette, we called front desk, they immediately sent security. Our only complaint would be the lack of water pressure. It was pretty pathetic, but not so bad that I couldn't shower. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all cost, a 1-star hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: KDJtraveler
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the location there would be nothing about this hotel that was positive.The room was slightly larger than a walk in closet and stunk like a moldy basement. The bathroom door had a broken hinge and couldn't close. The toilet didn't want to flush. The TV reception was terrible. There were cigarette butts all over the window ledge in this non smoking room. The shower was a joke..no pressure and tepid water temp. The shower curtain was too short so water got everywhere. The floors looked dirty and the paint on the woodwork was all chipped. The hallway smelled worse than the room and needed repairs to the walls and baseboards. There were picketers outside who kept blowing loud shrill whistles as they picketed. It took the valet over 1/2 hour to get our car for us from the parking lot just around the corner. If we could have found another hotel we would have ran as fast as we could from this one. All in all, the worse hotel experience we ever had. And all this at a 3-4 star price, what a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “What a crap hole”
Reviews.Author: karend9999
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know where to startâ€¦ upon our arrival we were greeted by picketers, who we had no idea were striking, who yelled something at us as we were unloading. We get to the front desk and I asked about the friends outside. They said they had been there for 10 years didnâ€™t I know that. I donâ€™t live near Chicago so how the hell would I know that. Ok, we get the key to our room, ride the elevator up, unlock the door and guess what? Someone was already in there. My sense of security just hit a new low. We go back and they thought they had checked out already. Ops, new security low. They gave us the room next door which had a real funky smell. We took a shower and went out.
